name: A structured representation of individuals' life histories, detailing personal information, educational and career trajectories, significant life events, relationships, and affiliations, each contextualized with temporal and spatial attributes to provide a comprehensive overview of a person's life journey.

classes.name: Person
classes.description: An individual human being, the main subject whose life events, relationships, and geographic movements are being described.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent any individual human whose biographical data is being modeled.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not be used for non-human entities.

classes.name: LifeEvent
classes.description: An occurrence or incident that represents a meaningful change or moment in a person's life, such as marriage, migration, birth, or retirement.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent significant events affecting a person's biography.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only model distinct and significant episodes, not daily or minor incidents.

classes.name: Location
classes.description: A geospatial place relevant to a person's life events, including cities, addresses, countries, or institutions like workplaces and schools.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent any concrete locality involved in life events or personal trajectories.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should reference recognizable geographical or institutional entities.

classes.name: FamilyRelationship
classes.description: A familial bond or connection between two people, capturing relationships such as parent, child, sibling, spouse, or extended family type.

usage_guideline.description: Use to classify and describe the type of relationship connecting two individuals who are part of the same family network.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each instance should represent exactly one family relationship between two people.

classes.name: Timeline
classes.description: A chronological sequence of life events and statuses for a given person, which can be visualized and analyzed over time.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent structured representations of a person's life as an ordered set of events, with linked ages and locations.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be associated with one person and may aggregate multiple events and periods.

classes.name: Marriage
classes.description: A life event in which two individuals form a legally or socially recognized partnership.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent instances of marriage involving a person.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used for legally, culturally, or socially recognized unions.

classes.name: Divorce
classes.description: A life event involving the legal dissolution of a marriage or partnership.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class for the formal termination of a marital relationship.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only represent actual, completed divorces or dissolutions.

classes.name: Childbirth
classes.description: A life event marking the birth of a child to a parent.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent the event of a child being born, linked to the parent(s) and child.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for birth events.

classes.name: Adoption
classes.description: A life event in which a person legally becomes the parent of a child who is not their biological offspring.

usage_guideline.description: Use for events where the legal parent-child relationship is established by adoption.
usage_guideline.constraints: Applicable where legal or formal adoption processes have occurred.

classes.name: HealthCrisis
classes.description: A significant adverse health event or period in a person's life, such as illness, injury, or medical emergency.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to model major health-related incidents impacting a person.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used for critical, notable health events only.

classes.name: Migration
classes.description: A life event where a person changes their residence across a significant geographic boundary, such as moving city, region, or country.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent moves involving meaningful geographic relocation.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be applied to moves of lasting significance or distance.

classes.name: Retirement
classes.description: A life event in which a person ceases regular paid employment or professional activity, typically marking the end of a career.

usage_guideline.description: Use to indicate formal withdrawal from active employment.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for events marking the intent to retire or formal retirement from work.

classes.name: UncertainEvent
classes.description: A life event or episode in a person’s timeline whose occurrence, timing, participants, or other relevant details are not known with certainty.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling events where the information is incomplete, ambiguous, disrupted, or otherwise uncertain.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used when a LifeEvent’s existence or properties (timing, participants, location, etc.) are indeterminate or contested.

classes.name: Organization
classes.description: A social institution, employer, academic entity, or other organized group to which a person may belong, be affiliated, or interact.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent schools, employers, clubs, societies, or community groups relevant to a person’s affiliations.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not be used for informal or ad hoc groupings unless they have some continuity or formal identity.

classes.name: CommunityGroup
classes.description: An informal or semi-formal group, club, union, or association with social, hobbyist, community, activist, or other shared purposes to which a person may be affiliated. Unlike organizations, community groups may lack formal institutional structure.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent clubs, unions, informal groups, or associations that operate below the level of formal organizations but exhibit some communal identity or continuity.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not be used for fully formalized organizations, employers, or educational institutions already covered by the Organization class. May represent ephemeral, grassroots, or loosely structured collectives.

classes.name: AffiliationRole
classes.description: A formal title, position, or status held by a person during the period of their affiliation with an organization, community group, or association (such as member, president, secretary, volunteer, etc.).

usage_guideline.description: Use to define the specific role or status that a person held within an affiliation context, including both formal and informal designations.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should reflect one role per affiliation period; use terms relevant to the context (e.g., 'member' for clubs, 'employee' for companies, 'chair' for committees).

classes.name: Source
classes.description: A documentary, archival, personal, or institutional source containing information about a person's life events, such as civil records, governmental registries, institutional databases, personal diaries, letters, or oral histories.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent any object, document, testimony, or artifact that serves as evidence for biographical record-keeping or research.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not include classes such as Person or Organization unless those are acting as the provenance for a source.

classes.name: SocialRelationship
classes.description: A non-familial relationship between two or more persons, capturing social, professional, mentoring, collegial, or friendship connections.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model ties between individuals who are connected through social or professional networks outside the family (e.g., mentor, colleague, friend).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be distinguished from FamilyRelationship. Multiple individuals can be involved in a SocialRelationship instance.

classes.name: SocialNetwork
classes.description: A collection or system of interrelated persons representing a social or professional community, network, or constellation (e.g., mentorship network, friends group, professional association).

usage_guideline.description: Use to group persons in a structure that supports the description and analysis of their broader social as well as professional communities.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not duplicate Organization, CommunityGroup, or other group membership; designed for modeling complex relationships across groups.

classes.name: Document
classes.description: A written, printed, or digital record that provides information or evidence about a person’s life, such as official certificates, manuscripts, letters, diaries, or any other documentary artifact relevant to biographical records.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent any physical or digital document that is referenced as evidence for biographical events or information about an individual.
usage_guideline.constraints: Do not use for oral histories, testimonies, or records that are not in material or digital form. Use appropriate subclasses for specific document types where necessary.

classes.name: Testimony
classes.description: A firsthand account, statement, or oral history provided by an individual as evidence or narrative of biographical events or experiences.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class for oral histories, interviews, autobiographical accounts, or any personal narratives provided directly by individuals.
usage_guideline.constraints: Testimony should be based on direct personal knowledge. Written testimonies may also be included if the personal account is primary.

classes.name: Movement
classes.description: A major social, political, or cultural collective action, ideology, period, or movement (such as suffrage, civil rights, reform, artistic, or religious movements) that impacts or involves individuals or life events.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent notable named or studied movements that have shaped or been reflected in individual biographies.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be created for historical, well-defined, or recognized movements, not for informal group actions or trends.

classes.name: EducationInterruption
classes.description: A life event or episode in which an individual's education is paused, delayed, suspended, or otherwise interrupted for a period due to various reasons, such as health, personal choice, or external circumstances.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent instances where formal or informal education is halted temporarily or permanently before resumption or completion.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used only for interruptions of significant duration or consequence, not minor or scheduled breaks.

classes.name: CareerInterruption
classes.description: A life event or episode where an individual's career progression is paused or discontinued for a temporary or extended period due to circumstances such as sabbaticals, parental leave, illness, or other personal reasons.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent instances where paid employment or professional activity is formally or informally interrupted.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only include interruptions of substantial duration; do not use for routine vacations or short-term absences.

classes.name: ResumptionEvent
classes.description: A life event marking the resumption or continuation of an individual's education or career following a period of interruption.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent the point at which a previously paused education or career activity is formally restarted.
usage_guideline.constraints: Must be temporally linked to a prior interruption event.

classes.name: JobTitle
classes.description: A formal or informal designation reflecting the position, rank, or title held by a person within an employment or career context (e.g., Teacher, Engineer, CEO).

usage_guideline.description: Use for specific roles or titles assigned during employment periods.
usage_guideline.constraints: Not intended for organization-wide roles; each instance should reflect a single role/designation within a given employment or career span.

classes.name: Employer
classes.description: An organization, company, institution, or entity for which a person works or has worked during an employment period.

usage_guideline.description: Use for organizations that serve as the direct employing body in a career trajectory.
usage_guideline.constraints: Do not duplicate with affiliations unless the entity is acting as an employer.

classes.name: CareerTransition
classes.description: A significant change, shift, or movement in a person's career path, such as changing employers, shifting professional fields, or taking on substantially different roles.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly model episodes where major career changes occur.
usage_guideline.constraints: Must indicate clear and consequential change in position, organization, or professional identity.

classes.name: UnemploymentPeriod
classes.description: A life event representing a time interval during which a person was not engaged in paid employment or professional activity.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling periods between jobs or careers where the individual was not employed.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should have clear start and (if applicable) end dates. Does not include voluntary sabbaticals or retirement unless characterized by involuntary lack of employment.

classes.name: Recognition
classes.description: An award, honor, commendation, or formal recognition received by an individual for achievements, contributions, or services within their career or educational history.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to model notable recognitions including awards, honors, distinctions, or certifications.
usage_guideline.constraints: Non-trivial recognitions relevant to career/education context only.

classes.name: CareerRole
classes.description: A specific function, responsibility, or designation that a person holds during a particular period within their career (e.g., Manager, Researcher, Advisor), potentially distinct from formal job title.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent roles, duties, or functions taken during employment, which may differ from official job titles.
usage_guideline.constraints: May coexist with JobTitle; useful to capture nuanced or multifaceted work roles.

classes.name: Consent
classes.description: A documented permission, agreement, or grant provided by an individual or authorized entity for the sharing, annotation, or processing of life history data.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to model formal consent records, including those for data access, research participation, or annotation purposes.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should include consent granter, recipient, scope, date, and any restrictions.

classes.name: LifeNarrative
classes.description: A qualitative, holistic, or interpretive account of a person's life, encompassing overarching stories, interpretations, or themes that contextualize structured life events.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent synthesized, descriptive, or narrative forms—such as biographies, memoirs, or thematic accounts—that provide interpretative perspectives on a person's life.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not duplicate Testimony or Document; reserved for synthesized narratives or high-level life stories rather than individual event records.

classes.name: QualitativeAnnotation
classes.description: A textual or interpretive note, annotation, or contextual commentary that supplements the representation of a life event or narrative with additional meaning or explanation.

usage_guideline.description: Use for qualitative text, interpretive notes, or narrative commentary associated with LifeEvents or LifeNarratives, such as personal reflections, scholarly context, or explanatory remarks.
usage_guideline.constraints: Annotations should be relevant, concise, and provide interpretative or contextual added value. Not to be confused with uncertainty notes.

classes.name: DigitalArtifact
classes.description: A digital file or object, such as a photograph, certificate, audio/video recording, or scanned document, that is associated with events or episodes in a person's life history.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent digital materials, files, or records—regardless of format—that are generated, collected, or associated with a person or their life events.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should include only digital (not physical-only) materials. May be subclassed for more specific artifact types if needed.

classes.name: PrivacyRestriction
classes.description: A specific constraint, mechanism, or rule that limits the visibility, sharing, or handling of personal data due to privacy, sensitivity, or risk concerns.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to track individual-level or document-level privacy restrictions, limitations, or risk-based access constraints on biographical or life history data.
usage_guideline.constraints: Avoid using for general consent records; focus on concrete, actionable restrictions or flagged sensitivity.

classes.name: SensitiveInformation
classes.description: A category or flag indicating that certain data or information related to a person or life event is especially sensitive, at-risk, or subject to heightened protection.

usage_guideline.description: Use to identify and flag data that requires special confidentiality, such as at-risk personal details, information on minors, or culturally sensitive records.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be set only where an explicit determination of sensitivity is present.

classes.name: AccessControlPolicy
classes.description: A defined set of rules or configurations that determine who may access, view, edit, or share specific personal data, digital artifacts, or biographical records.

usage_guideline.description: Use to denote the policies that govern access (authorization, authentication, or prohibition) to data/artifacts at the person, event, or artifact level.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each policy should describe concrete access rules and be linked to relevant data items.

classes.name: Relocation
classes.description: A life event in which an individual changes their place of residence or usual living situation, involving a move that does not necessarily cross significant geographic or political boundaries (such as moving within a city, to a new neighborhood, or a different residence).

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent residential moves that are not migrations (i.e., do not cross major political/geographic boundaries), or that are of a more local, routine, or administrative nature.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used only for non-trivial relocations (more than temporary stays, visits, or holidays).

classes.name: Travel
classes.description: A life event in which an individual undertakes a journey or movement for a defined purpose without establishing a new residence, such as visiting other places for work, study, leisure, or other reasons.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent temporary movements or journeys that do not change the individual's principal residence.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be distinct from Migration and Relocation; include durations, purposes, and destinations if available.

classes.name: EnvironmentalDisruption
classes.description: An environmental event or phenomenon that causes significant disruption to individuals or communities, such as natural disasters, severe weather events, or climate-related incidents.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent disruptive environmental events (e.g., earthquake, flood, drought) that have a concrete impact on one or more individuals' lives.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used only when there is a clear link to persons or life events.

classes.name: EconomicDisruption
classes.description: An event or episode resulting from broad economic changes or crises, such as recessions, depressions, or major financial upheavals, which materially impact an individual's or community's life path.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to disruptions from economic phenomena (e.g., loss of employment due to recession).
usage_guideline.constraints: Reserve for significant economic events, not ordinary financial fluctuations.

classes.name: SocietalDisruption
classes.description: A collective social, political, or civil event (such as war, pandemic, revolution, or mass migration) that significantly disrupts the normal course of individuals' or groups' lives.

usage_guideline.description: Use for major societal-scale disruptions affecting life histories (e.g., pandemic, war, civil unrest).
usage_guideline.constraints: Apply only when disruption has demonstrable impact on the person or event being modeled.

classes.name: Annotation
classes.description: A structured note, semantic tag, or commentary added to life events, narratives, or data entries to provide enrichment, explanation, or semantic classification beyond the factual record.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent any structured enrichment of life data, including semantic tags, thematic notes, scholarly commentary, or interpretive labeling attached to specific records or events.
usage_guideline.constraints: Distinct from QualitativeAnnotation, which is primarily free-text; Annotation may comprise structured or controlled tags, comments, or links to vocabularies.

classes.name: VerificationStatus
classes.description: A categorization or assessment indicating the degree of confidence, confirmation, or validation that a life event, narrative entry, or data point is accurate and supported by evidence.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model the reliability, confirmedness, or verification level of information, such as 'verified', 'unverified', 'contested', or 'pending'.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should use controlled vocabulary. Each instance reflects the verification assessment for a particular datum or event.

classes.name: EducationEpisode
classes.description: A distinct period in an individual's educational trajectory, representing formal or informal enrollment, study, or completion at a specific institution or program, potentially leading to credentials or degrees.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling each educational segment or period (such as enrollment at a school, university, or training program), capturing start and end dates, location, field of study, and outcome (credential).
usage_guideline.constraints: Do not use for isolated classes or workshops; should cover structured education of significant duration.

classes.name: Credential
classes.description: A formally awarded certificate, degree, diploma, or other recognition granted upon completion of an educational episode or program.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model degrees, diplomas, certifications, and similar awards conferred by educational institutions.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be linked to the relevant EducationEpisode and Institution. Avoid using for informal recognitions or non-institutional awards.

classes.name: Program
classes.description: A structured curriculum or course of study offered by an educational institution, such as a degree program, training track, or certification curriculum.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent discrete programs, tracks, or structured curricula within an institution to which an individual might be admitted or enrolled.
usage_guideline.constraints: Programs should be institution-specific; do not use for general fields of study.

classes.name: FieldOfStudy
classes.description: An area, discipline, or subject in which an individual pursues systematic study during an education episode or program.

usage_guideline.description: Use to designate the academic, vocational, or thematic focus of an educational episode or program (e.g., History, Biology, Engineering).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should follow recognized academic or training fields. Use controlled vocabularies where possible.

classes.name: Institution
classes.description: An educational entity such as a school, college, university, or academy that offers formal programs, awards credentials, and hosts education episodes.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent the physical or organizational entity where education occurs, distinct from the Organization class when the context is strictly educational.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use for modeling formal education providers only. Do not duplicate with Organization unless necessary for hierarchical structure.

classes.name: Mentorship
classes.description: A social relationship where one person (mentor) offers guidance, knowledge, or support to another (mentee), particularly influencing educational or career development.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent mentorship relations, specifying participants and time period. Distinguish from general SocialRelationship by the reflective influence on career or educational trajectories.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each Mentorship instance should have at least a mentor and a mentee; use only when there is an explicit, ongoing guidance role.

classes.name: SocioEconomicStatusChange
classes.description: A life episode or event marking a significant transition in an individual's socio-economic standing, due to factors such as education, employment, income shifts, or major life events.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling major upward/downward status changes, linking with causes where possible.
usage_guideline.constraints: Document only validated, impactful changes. Do not use for minor fluctuations.

classes.name: LegalEvent
classes.description: An event involving a legally significant action or episode in a person's life, such as changes in citizenship, court cases, legal recognition of name or status, or other matters affecting legal identity or standing.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent legally recognized events that impact an individual's official identity, status, or life trajectory.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for events with clear legal significance, not for ordinary administrative actions.

classes.name: NameChange
classes.description: A legal event in which an individual formally changes their name, recognized by official authority or documentation.

usage_guideline.description: Use for legally documented or recognized changes of an individual's name.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not be used for informal aliases or nicknames.

classes.name: StatusChange
classes.description: A legal event in which an individual's legal status (such as marital status, citizenship, or residency) is altered by court decision, official process, or recognized authority.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent events in which a legal status attribute of a person is formally altered.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only cover events with official, legal impact.

classes.name: CourtCase
classes.description: A legal event in which an individual is involved in a court proceeding, which may affect their life trajectory (e.g., civil, criminal, immigration, or family court cases).

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling formal court proceedings in which an individual is a party (plaintiff, defendant, etc.).
usage_guideline.constraints: Do not use for informal disputes or non-court mediation.

classes.name: CitizenshipChange
classes.description: A legal event marking the acquisition, loss, or change of citizenship status for an individual.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling grant, renunciation, revocation, or other changes in an individual's citizenship.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for formally documented changes.

classes.name: CareerMilestone
classes.description: A significant achievement, position, or role within a person's career trajectory, typically marking an important transition or accomplishment including appointments, major projects, or recognitions.

usage_guideline.description: Use for significant career points such as attaining a key position, completing an important project, or receiving substantial professional recognition.
usage_guideline.constraints: Do not use for routine career activities; milestones should mark distinct and meaningful career progress.

classes.name: ArchivalStatus
classes.description: A categorical value indicating the archival state or disposition of a record element, such as active, archived, or uncertain.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the current archival state of biographical or record elements for a person.
usage_guideline.constraints: Recommended values include 'active', 'archived', and 'uncertain'; extend only if required by domain context.

classes.name: RecordElement
classes.description: A discrete component or piece of an individual's personal record, such as files, data fields, or documented entities subject to archival status and modification history.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model identifiable parts of a person's record for archival management, provenance, or status tracking.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used to refer to record components whose status, modification, or access may be tracked independently.

classes.name: MigrationPathway
classes.description: A structured representation of the origin, destination, sequence, and associated episodes of migration, relocation, or resettlement experienced by a person.

usage_guideline.description: Use for complex or multi-stage moves involving multiple migrations, relocations, or resettlement events for a given person.
usage_guideline.constraints: Apply only when a trajectory or series of movements (not a single migration event) is represented.

classes.name: HouseholdComposition
classes.description: A configuration describing the people, relationships, and structure of a person's living arrangement or household at a particular time.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model household groupings, membership, and structures at specific time points or periods in an individual's life.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should capture household as constituted at a specific point in time, with possible links to FamilyRelationship and Person.

classes.name: LivingArrangement
classes.description: A description of the residential, domestic, or custodial arrangement in which a person resides at a particular time, encompassing context such as cohabitation, independence, or institutional residence.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent how and with whom a person lives at a specific period, including institutional or communal arrangements.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should capture non-household living contexts such as group homes, dormitories, or institutions.

classes.name: PrivacyManagementMechanism
classes.description: A method, process, policy, or technology employed to ensure, monitor, or enforce privacy requirements for personal or sensitive data.

usage_guideline.description: Use to document and specify concrete privacy management strategies associated with personal, sensitive, or regulated data.
usage_guideline.constraints: May include technical, procedural, or policy approaches; link to relevant Consent and PrivacyRestriction instances as needed.

classes.name: EthicalGuideline
classes.description: A set of principles, codes, or rules governing the ethical management, use, and protection of personal data, especially in relation to consent and sensitive information.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to reference or model formal ethical frameworks or codes applicable to data handling.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should represent externally recognized guidelines, standards, or regulatory codes.

classes.name: SensitivePersonalData
classes.description: A class representing information about an individual that is considered sensitive under legal, ethical, or institutional standards and requires special protection.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model and classify information about a person deemed sensitive (e.g., medical data, identifying details, risks to safety or privacy).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for data meeting criteria for heightened protection due to risk or legal status.

classes.name: QualitativeTag
classes.description: A textual or controlled-vocabulary keyword, concept, or theme assigned to data, life events, or persons to capture qualitative, interpretive, or thematic elements. Tags may express cross-cutting themes, topics, or perspectives enriching structured biographical data.

usage_guideline.description: Use for assigning interpretive, thematic, or analytical keywords or concepts not fully captured as formal annotations or narrative accounts. Tags may be constrained to controlled vocabularies or open-ended. Distinct from structured Annotation and QualitativeAnnotation classes.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be meaningful within the analytic or interpretive context. May be reused across multiple data elements or persons; do not use for purely factual labeling.

classes.name: NonFormalLearningExperience
classes.description: A learning episode occurring outside of formal educational programs or institutions but involving organized and structured learning, such as workshops, short courses, vocational training, or adult education programs.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model episodes of organized learning distinct from accredited, credentialed, or institution-based programs. Includes structured but non-institutional learning.
usage_guideline.constraints: Do not use for informal, unstructured learning (see InformalLearningExperience). Should capture duration, topic, and provider if available.

classes.name: InformalLearningExperience
classes.description: A learning episode occurring outside formal and non-formal educational settings, typically through self-study, experience, family, peer groups, or other unstructured contexts.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent episodes where knowledge or skills are acquired through personal experiences, daily activities, or community/social participation without intentional curricular structure.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for informal learning not captured by EducationEpisode or NonFormalLearningExperience.

classes.name: OfficialIdentifier
classes.description: A government-issued or authoritative identifier assigned to a person, such as a national ID number, passport number, or similar unique official reference.

usage_guideline.description: Use for formal, verifiable identifiers issued by official bodies or authorities.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be assigned to persons who possess such documented identifiers; includes numbers such as national identification, passport, or similar.

classes.name: DemographicAttribute
classes.description: A characteristic or trait such as gender, ethnicity, nationality, or other personal demography assigned to or describing an individual.

usage_guideline.description: Use for attributes capturing demographic details of individuals relevant to identity or biography.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only represent core demographic features as defined by domain standards.

classes.name: MembershipStatus
classes.description: An indicator or classification denoting a person’s current or historical status of membership within an organization, association, or community group (such as active member, former member, honorary, pending, etc.).

usage_guideline.description: Use to express the nature and state of an individual's connection to a group or association.
usage_guideline.constraints: Controlled terms preferred; one status per membership record per time period.

classes.name: ContextualFactor
classes.description: A relevant circumstance, environmental condition, tradition, or regional/historical event that forms the backdrop for or influences a person’s life events or milestones.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling major contextual influences such as traditions, significant local/national events, or environmental factors impacting an individual.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be concretely referenced or evidenced within biographical context.

classes.name: LifeMilestone
classes.description: A significant, defined achievement or turning point in a person’s life history, such as completion of education, marriage, or career appointment.

usage_guideline.description: Use for life-shaping points distinct from ordinary life events, typically celebrated or formally recognized.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be reserved for major, widely recognized milestones.

classes.name: DataAccessRecord
classes.description: A record capturing the details of access to a person's life history data, including who accessed the data, when, for what purpose, and under what consent or restriction.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to model individual acts or episodes of access to personal or life history data, supporting audit trails and consent verification.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should represent discrete access events. Include information on the accessing party and related consent when possible.

classes.name: NameHistory
classes.description: A chronological record of the various names used by an individual over time, including formal, legal, and alternative names.

usage_guideline.description: Use to document the evolution of a person's names through events such as name changes, adoptions, or use of pseudonyms.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each instance should describe one period or version of a name in the individual's history.

classes.name: LegalStatusHistory
classes.description: A record of the sequence of legal statuses held by an individual over time, such as changes in citizenship, marital status, or other official designations.

usage_guideline.description: Use for tracking the official legal status of a person at different points, reflecting changes due to events or official acts.
usage_guideline.constraints: Record each status and associated time period; reserved for statuses with formal, legal recognition.

classes.name: IdentifierHistory
classes.description: A sequence of official identifiers assigned to an individual over their life, including context and periods of validity.

usage_guideline.description: Document the various official identifiers assigned to a person and the time periods in which they were active.
usage_guideline.constraints: Include start and end dates, identifier type, and issuing authority where possible.

classes.name: ChangeTriggerEvent
classes.description: An event or occurrence that prompts or results in a change to an individual's name, legal status, or official identifier.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly model the causative event (e.g., marriage, adoption, court order) behind a legal or personal status change.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be linked to both the affected history (name, status, identifier) and the causative LifeEvent or LegalEvent.

classes.name: StatusIndicator
classes.description: A categorical or descriptive label assigned to a data point in a person's life story, indicating its current state, disposition, or reliability such as 'active', 'archived', 'uncertain', or 'discontinued'.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent the status or disposition of a specific biographical data point or record element in the context of a person's life story.
usage_guideline.constraints: Controlled vocabulary should be used; distinguish from verification status and archival status as needed.

classes.name: ConsentPermission
classes.description: A specific permission, access instruction, or condition defined within a consent agreement, describing allowed, restricted, or conditional uses of personal life history data.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model explicit permissions, access rights, or usage conditions for life history data as defined within a consent form or agreement.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should enumerate permissions such as access type, duration, or purpose; do not use for general statements—link to specific data uses or actors.

classes.name: EducationalSequence
classes.description: A structured, ordered collection of educational institutions or episodes that an individual attended, supporting their chronological sequencing and analysis.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent the full ordered sequence of formal education (such as schools, colleges, universities) for a person, including institutional order and transitions.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each EducationalSequence instance should reference all relevant EducationEpisodes or Institutions in order; designed for representing overall educational trajectory rather than a single episode.

classes.name: IntersectionalContext
classes.description: A social or biographical context reflecting the convergence of multiple identity categories, statuses, backgrounds, or forms of participation that influence a person's life experiences and events (e.g., intersections of migration, minority status, cultural background, or community participation).

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent complex contexts or circumstances resulting from overlapping social identities (e.g., culture, minority status, migration) that together shape individual experiences.
usage_guideline.constraints: Context must involve two or more intersecting dimensions or statuses relevant to the person or event; should not be used for single-dimension context.

classes.name: TemporalDetail
classes.description: Information or annotation specifying the time-related particulars of a migration, relocation, or travel event, such as sequence, duration, or temporal patterning.

usage_guideline.description: Use to capture complex temporal aspects of mobility episodes, including timing of moves, durations, or chronological patterns relevant to understanding life trajectories.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be instantiated for episodes/events where temporal sequence or patterns are salient and not covered by basic date/duration properties.

classes.name: SpatialDetail
classes.description: Information or annotation specifying the spatial, geographic, or locational particulars of a migration, relocation, or travel event, such as specific routes, regions, or mapping details.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record additional spatial dimensions of a movement event, such as detailed origins, destinations, interim stops, or mapped patterns, beyond the basic Location linkage.
usage_guideline.constraints: Provide only when more granular spatial detail is required for analysis or visualization; should supplement, not duplicate, existing Location properties.

classes.name: MulticulturalContext
classes.description: A context reflecting a person's or event's involvement in or experience of multiple cultures, cultural practices, or cross-cultural environments.

usage_guideline.description: Use to document episodes or circumstances where multicultural factors, cultural blending, or cross-cultural experiences are salient for interpretation.
usage_guideline.constraints: Reserve for cases where engagement with more than one cultural identity, value system, or group is explicit and relevant to the narrative.

classes.name: CurationAction
classes.description: An action or process in which a person or entity authors, curates, edits, or modifies a record, document, or entry related to an individual's life history.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly represent actions where a record is created, authored, curated, or subsequently modified for provenance and auditing purposes.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used for discrete, attributable actions involving biographical record creation or update. Not for generic access or viewing.

classes.name: SelfNarrative
classes.description: A first-person narrative or self-descriptive account provided by an individual, describing their own life events, transitions, roles, or reflections.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent direct autobiographical accounts or self-reflections authored by the subject person, distinct from third-party testimonies or synthesized narratives.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for accounts originated by the subject individual.

classes.name: LifePhase
classes.description: A distinct period or phase within an individual's life trajectory, characterized by shared features, roles, or statuses (e.g., childhood, adolescence, working adulthood, retirement).

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent intervals within a person's life that group multiple events and states according to developmental, social, or biographical criteria.
usage_guideline.constraints: Life phases may overlap and may be defined differently according to context or culture; specify delimiting criteria or context where possible.

classes.name: Transition
classes.description: A major change or passage that marks the movement from one life phase, status, or arrangement to another in an individual’s biography (e.g., finishing school, becoming a parent, entering retirement).

usage_guideline.description: Use to denote changes that signal the end of one status or phase and the beginning of another, especially when the transition is significant or recognized in the biographical context.
usage_guideline.constraints: Transitions should reflect meaningful, non-trivial changes, not routine daily activities.

classes.name: Disruption
classes.description: An event or episode, not otherwise covered by specific disruption subclasses, that interrupts, disturbs, or alters the expected trajectory of a person's life, potentially including unanticipated breaks, losses, or interruptions.

usage_guideline.description: Use for life-affecting disruptions that do not fit more specific categories like education/career interruption or societal/environmental/economic disruption, such as divorce, bereavement, or other ad-hoc breakpoints.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only use for consequential disruptions; avoid overlap with precise subclasses (EnvironmentalDisruption, EconomicDisruption, SocietalDisruption, etc.).

classes.name: RoleInGroup
classes.description: A specific role, position, or function held by a person within a volunteer, advocacy, or cultural group, such as 'volunteer', 'member', 'organizer', 'participant', or similar designations reflecting their responsibility or standing in the group.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the distinct function, status, or appointment an individual holds during participation in advocacy, volunteer, or cultural groups, especially when such groups are not formal organizations.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should represent only one role per group participation episode; use context-specific terminology consistent with the group’s practices.

classes.name: NarrativeTranslation
classes.description: A version or rendering of a personal narrative, oral history, or testimony in a language other than the original; used to represent the multilingual or multicultural contextualization of a narrative.

usage_guideline.description: Use for each distinct translated or adapted version of a narrative, testimony, or oral history available in another language or cultural context.
usage_guideline.constraints: A given narrative or testimony may have zero or more translations; each translation represents a unique language or significant cultural adaptation.

classes.name: GroupParticipation
classes.description: A biographical episode or event in which a person takes part in a volunteer, advocacy, cultural, or similar group that is not classified as a formal organization, including time period, group identity, and held role(s).

usage_guideline.description: Model instances of active participation in civil, cultural, advocacy, or volunteer groups, capturing relevant time periods and roles. Distinguish from employment or formal organizational affiliation.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only use when the participation is consequential and structured enough to warrant tracking (not purely informal or one-off activities).

classes.name: PersonalNarrative
classes.description: A first-person account or story, including oral histories or testimonies, about a person’s life, typically reflecting their perspective, experiences, or interpretations, with potential for translation or adaptation.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent narrative sources, oral testimonies, or personal stories, whether written, recorded, or transcribed, particularly those available in multiple languages or frameworks.
usage_guideline.constraints: Reserve for direct, first-person biographical narratives; distinguish from third-person narratives or synthesized life stories.

classes.name: Implication
classes.description: An outcome, consequence, or effect resulting from a specific legal event, life event, or participation, such as a change in status, eligibility, rights, or obligations.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the documented effect(s) of legal events or participation episodes (e.g., becoming a citizen, right to reside, loss or gain of certain privileges).
usage_guideline.constraints: Link only to events for which specific, recognized implications are documented.

classes.name: Apprenticeship
classes.description: A structured, often long-term, informal or non-formal learning experience characterized by hands-on skill acquisition under the supervision of a skilled mentor, typically outside a formal educational program.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent episodes where a person acquires skills or expertise through practical training and mentorship, such as craft, trade, or artistic apprenticeships.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be categorized under informal or non-formal learning experiences, not formal education. Distinct from self-taught or community learning.

classes.name: SelfTaughtLearning
classes.description: An informal learning experience in which an individual acquires knowledge or skills through independent study and practice, without structured support from institutions, mentors, or peer groups.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling periods or episodes of self-directed learning, autodidactic activities, and personal skill acquisition without formal or non-formal settings.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only use when the knowledge/skill was primarily acquired independently, distinct from group/community or organizational instruction.

classes.name: CommunityInstruction
classes.description: An informal learning experience based on social, community-based, or group-centric instruction, typically occurring through community organizations, peer-led classes, or communal learning environments.

usage_guideline.description: Use to capture learning that takes place in communal or group settings outside formal institutions (e.g., community workshops, cooperative learning, neighborhood classes).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not be used for formal education or fully self-directed learning. Distinct from Apprenticeship, which emphasizes individual mentorship.

classes.name: Attachment
classes.description: A relationship or linkage through which a source, document, digital artifact, or annotation is explicitly associated with a person’s life history as a supporting or evidentiary material (e.g., a photograph, video, audio, or scanned document attached to the life record).

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent an explicit association or attachment of a multimedia artifact, source, or record to a person's life history, timeline, or event. Enables modeling of the 'attachment' or inclusion context distinct from mere referencing.
usage_guideline.constraints: An Attachment instance must link at least one artifact (e.g., photo, audio, video, document) to the appropriate person, event, or timeline; different attachments can have differing attachment types and descriptive context.

classes.name: Language
classes.description: A natural language spoken, written, or understood by a person, relevant to their communication ability, cultural background, or life history.

usage_guideline.description: Use for representing distinct natural languages associated with an individual, for biography, communication, or background analysis.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should correspond to recognized natural languages; do not use for programming or artificial languages.

classes.name: LanguageProficiency
classes.description: A record of a person's proficiency or competence in a given language, including level and context (e.g., native, fluent, conversational, basic).

usage_guideline.description: Use to model the different levels of language proficiency for a person in specific languages.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each instance should be tied to one person and one language; ensure to use for emphasized or contextually relevant proficiencies.

classes.name: SabbaticalPeriod
classes.description: A distinct period during which a person temporarily withdraws from their regular employment or professional duties, often for study, research, personal development, or rest.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record formal or informal sabbaticals, distinguishing from involuntary unemployment or routine leave.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should represent substantial, non-routine career breaks; not used for short leaves or vacations.

classes.name: ReasonForInterruption
classes.description: A classification or description explaining the cause or reason for an interruption, break, sabbatical, or unemployment period in a person's life history.

usage_guideline.description: Use for capturing the explanatory factor behind life interruptions, such as health, personal choice, education, family, or external circumstances.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be concise and use controlled or standard terms where possible; one per interruption episode.

classes.name: Promotion
classes.description: A career milestone or event in which an individual is advanced to a higher position or rank within an organization or profession, typically as a recognition of merit, experience, or achievement.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent upward movement within a professional context, such as being promoted to a higher title, role, or responsibility.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for formal or substantive promotions as part of career progression. Not intended for routine hierarchical adjustments without increased responsibility.

classes.name: Demotion
classes.description: A career milestone or event in which an individual is reassigned to a lower position, title, or level of responsibility within an organization or profession.

usage_guideline.description: Apply when documenting downward changes in occupational rank or role, such as loss of position or title.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only record formal or consequential demotions, not temporary assignments or informal reductions.

classes.name: EntrepreneurialActivity
classes.description: A career milestone or event in which a person initiates, founds, or significantly develops a business, enterprise, or self-employment venture.

usage_guideline.description: Use to capture significant entrepreneurial actions, such as founding a company, initiating a startup, or launching a major independent business.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only include substantial, documented ventures; do not use for minor, informal, or one-off business activities.

classes.name: ReligiousAffiliation
classes.description: A formal or informal association that a person has with a particular religion, denomination, or spiritual tradition during a specified period of their life.

usage_guideline.description: Use this class to represent an individual's connection to religious identity, group, or practice at particular times during their life trajectory.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should capture the religion, denomination, or tradition, and be linked to relevant periods or contexts; do not use for general beliefs unless directly linked to affiliation.

classes.name: LanguageUseContext
classes.description: A situation, domain, or environment in which a person uses a particular language, such as at home, in the workplace, within a cultural group, or during specific life events.

usage_guideline.description: Model distinctive settings or contexts in which a person utilizes a language (e.g., within their family, in education, at work, during migration).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used in conjunction with LanguageProficiency to clarify the role or scope of language use; multiple contexts may be present for one language.

classes.name: CareerMilestoneType
classes.description: A classification or category denoting the type of career milestone, such as employment, promotion, recognition, or period of unemployment, contributing to the structure of occupational history.

usage_guideline.description: Assign to CareerMilestone instances to specify their particular type (e.g., employment, promotion, unemployment, recognition).
usage_guideline.constraints: Use controlled vocabulary to maintain consistency; not intended for routine job duties but for notable episodes only.

classes.name: PreferredName
classes.description: A name that an individual prefers to be known by, which may differ from their legal name or aliases. Preferred names can reflect personal choice, cultural context, or social identity.

usage_guideline.description: Use to document the name an individual chooses to use in daily life, communication, or institutional contexts when it differs from legal or birth names. Suitable for recording chosen names, including those adopted for social, cultural, or gender identity reasons.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not be used for legal names (see NameChange or NameHistory) or for nicknames/aliases unless explicitly designated as a preferred name by the individual.

classes.name: Alias
classes.description: An alternative name or pseudonym by which an individual is known, distinct from legal or preferred names. Aliases may be informal, community-specific, creative, or used in particular contexts.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record any pseudonym, informal name, or handle that an individual has used, especially in public, artistic, or digital contexts. Can include stage names, pen names, nicknames, or online identities.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for names that are actively used or sufficiently documented; do not overlap with legal names or official preferred names.

classes.name: Degree
classes.description: A formal academic qualification, such as a bachelor's, master's, or doctoral degree, that is typically awarded by a recognized educational institution upon successful completion of a specified program of study.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent officially conferred academic qualifications as part of an individual's educational history.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for academic degrees awarded by recognized institutions; distinguish from certifications, diplomas, or licenses.

classes.name: Certification
classes.description: A formal credential that verifies an individual's qualification or competence in a particular field or profession, usually awarded after meeting specific criteria or passing an examination.

usage_guideline.description: Use for official attestations of skill or knowledge beyond academic degrees or diplomas, such as professional certifications (e.g., teaching certificate, IT certification).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only include officially recognized certifications; avoid use for informal certificates of attendance.

classes.name: Diploma
classes.description: A document issued by an educational institution certifying the successful completion of a particular course of study or program, typically below the level of a degree.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to represent formal completion of secondary education, vocational training, or similar programs resulting in a diploma document.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be awarded by recognized educational institutions; do not conflate with degrees or informal certifications.

classes.name: License
classes.description: A formal, legal authorization granted to an individual permitting them to engage in a regulated profession or activity, often subject to renewal or revocation.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent licensure required for regulated careers (e.g., medical license, teaching license, driver's license).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should reflect legally binding credentialing requirements only.

classes.name: MultimediaArtifact
classes.description: A tangible or digital artifact consisting of multimedia content such as a photograph, video, or audio recording, associated with a person's life history or events.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to represent substantive, identifiable multimedia materials relevant to biographical records, regardless of storage format.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should cover only individual, discrete artifacts (files or objects); do not use for general classes of artifacts.

classes.name: AncestryDetail
classes.description: Information describing the lineage, ancestry, or hereditary background of a person, capturing genealogical details across generations.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record and represent specific genealogical information such as known ancestors, descent lines, or ancestral origins for a Person.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used for well-documented ancestry or lineage records; not intended for vague or unsubstantiated claims.

classes.name: IntergenerationalConnection
classes.description: A relationship or linkage that represents a connection, pattern, or structure spanning multiple generations within a family or wider kin group.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to explicate generational relationships such as grandparent–grandchild, great-grandparent–descendant, or other lineages involving multi-generation spans.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use to contextualize relationships that cross more than two generations; must specify relevant persons and generational gap.

classes.name: EmploymentPeriod
classes.description: A discrete period during which a person is employed in a specific job or role for a given employer, including starting and ending dates, job title, and location.

usage_guideline.description: Use to capture segments of an individual's work history tied to positions held, employers, job titles, and locations, distinguishing each continuous or discrete employment engagement.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should include employment start/end dates, position, employer, and location. Model each job/role as a distinct instance; excludes periods of unemployment.

classes.name: GeographicContext
classes.description: A contextual factor that records the relevant geographic environment, scope, or location associated with a particular event, role, or background in a person's life.

usage_guideline.description: Use to provide additional geographic context relating to life events, roles, or background—not merely the event location but broader geographic influences (e.g. region of upbringing, context of employment).
usage_guideline.constraints: May supplement occurredAtLocation; use when geographic circumstance is relevant to interpretation or biographical context.

classes.name: CulturalContext
classes.description: A context capturing the cultural, religious, or linguistic background factors that provide interpretive meaning to a person's life events or trajectory.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to link cultural, religious, or linguistic dimensions specifically to the contextualization of a person’s significant life events.
usage_guideline.constraints: Do not use for generic cultural background (covered by hasCulturalBackground); instead use for interpretive contexts where background has explanatory or analytical significance for events.

classes.name: NameType
classes.description: A controlled categorization representing the type of name used by a person, such as 'legal', 'preferred', 'alias', or other meaningful distinctions.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the category or role of a given name within a person's NameHistory (e.g., distinguishing between formal/legal names, preferred names, pseudonyms, or informal aliases).
usage_guideline.constraints: Use controlled vocabulary (such as 'legal', 'preferred', 'alias') for consistency. One type per NameHistory instance; not to be confused with context of use.

classes.name: Award
classes.description: A specific formal award, honor, or recognition conferred upon an individual by an organization, institution, or community in acknowledgment of notable achievement or contribution.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent named awards, formal recognitions, or honors (e.g., prizes, medals, fellowships) distinct from informal achievements. Link to person/recipient and awarding context.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only include officially conferred awards or honors; does not cover informal achievements or minor recognitions.

classes.name: InformalAchievement
classes.description: A notable personal or professional accomplishment, recognition, or distinction achieved by an individual outside the scope of formal awards or honors.

usage_guideline.description: Use for significant but informal recognitions, such as community acknowledgments, major personal breakthroughs, or informal career/academic milestones.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should represent meaningful achievements that have contextual relevance but lack official institutional recognition.

classes.name: AwardingBody
classes.description: An organization, institution, club, society, community group, or authoritative entity responsible for conferring awards, honors, or recognitions to individuals.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent any body or authority that formally or informally grants awards or recognitions, including but not limited to professional societies, foundations, clubs, or community organizations.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be linked to awards/recognitions they confer and the contexts in which they operate.

classes.name: AnnotationAttachment
classes.description: A structured association linking an annotation, commentary, or interpretive note to a specific element of structured biographical data, such as a life event, relationship, or data segment.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling the explicit attachment or linkage of external annotations, commentaries, or interpretive contributions to existing structured biographical data.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should represent the mechanism or context of attachment, and not duplicate direct annotation/content nodes.

classes.name: GroupMembership
classes.description: A record or episode representing a person's membership and participation in a defined group, including formal organizations, community groups, or networks, with associated roles, periods, and statuses.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly model individual group membership episodes to track the group, role(s) held, duration, and membership status (e.g., active, former). Distinguish from broader network participation or informal social connections.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each instance should represent one person's membership in one group during a specific period; use additional object/data properties to specify details.

classes.name: InformalNetwork
classes.description: A type of group or collective formed through less formalized, possibly online or ad hoc, social, professional, or interest-based association, lacking clear organizational structure.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent online, digital, or unstructured groups that are relevant to biographical analysis when group structure or continuity is not formalized.
usage_guideline.constraints: Do not use for formal organizations or community groups with enduring identities; should be used for networks where boundaries and membership are fluid.

classes.name: LineageRecord
classes.description: A structured record representing a documented line of descent, ancestry, or genealogical pathway across multiple generations within a family or community.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model explicit descent, ancestry, or lineage records that connect individuals through generational pathways; supports analysis of family or community genealogies.
usage_guideline.constraints: Establish links between multiple Person instances according to documentable lines of descent or ancestral connection; only use for substantiated relationships.

classes.name: DisabilityEvent
classes.description: A significant life event in which a person acquires, experiences, or recovers from a physical, sensory, intellectual, or mental disability. This can include the onset of a disability, periods of adaptation, rehabilitation, and recovery episodes if applicable.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly represent major episodes where disability status changes (onset, diagnosis, recovery, significant adaptation) are part of a person's life history or records. Should distinguish between chronic, temporary, or resolved disabilities where relevant.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for consequential disability-related events, as documented or known within personal records.

classes.name: RecoveryEvent
classes.description: A life event marking a notable recovery from a disability or major health event, representing the conclusion or substantial improvement of a disabling condition.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record documented and meaningful episodes where an individual recovers from a disability or major health crisis, particularly when rehabilitation or restoration of function is significant to the life narrative.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used when recovery is medically/biographically significant; omit for minor or transient recoveries.

classes.name: ProfessionalRecognition
classes.description: A formal or notable informal acknowledgment of an individual's professional accomplishments, competence, or distinction, occurring within the context of their career history. Includes professional awards, honors, titles, fellow/fellowship election, peer recognitions, and other status-marking events.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent substantial recognitions such as professional society fellowships, honorary titles, or formal designations. Should also be used for informal but widely acknowledged professional achievements not covered by awards or certifications.
usage_guideline.constraints: Exclude recognitions that are trivial, purely ceremonial, or do not reflect genuine professional achievement.

classes.name: CertificationAchievement
classes.description: An official certification obtained by an individual as part of their career, granted to attest to specific professional competence or qualification.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling the achievement of professional certifications that are career-relevant, such as licensure, board certification, or other formal attestations not captured by educational Credential.
usage_guideline.constraints: Apply only to recognized certifications with formal assessment and/or issuing body.

classes.name: InformalProfessionalAchievement
classes.description: A notable informal achievement in a professional context that is recognized by peers, communities, or organizations but does not rise to the level of a formal award or certification.

usage_guideline.description: Use for accomplishments such as peer-elected positions, informal community recognitions, or significant milestones acknowledged by professional networks.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not be used for routine performance but only for widely acknowledged, contextually meaningful achievements.

classes.name: ChronologicalSequence
classes.description: An ordered sequence representing the precise chronological ordering of life events, narratives, or testimonies in a person's history.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model the explicit temporal arrangement of major events, testimonies, or narrative elements when sequencing or ordering is analytically required.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used for comprehensive or focal sequences; do not use for unordered collections or aggregates.

classes.name: GeographicMapping
classes.description: A structured representation depicting the mapping of life events, episodes, or narratives to geographic coordinates, locations, or regions within a person's history.

usage_guideline.description: Use to establish and document the geographic context or visual mapping of events, allowing events to be related or visualized geographically.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should supplement, not replace, basic location linkage; use for spatial visualizations, mapping, or geographic analyses.

classes.name: NonTraditionalPathway
classes.description: A deviation or variation from the expected or typical sequence of life events, educational progression, or career development, including interruptions, breaks, or alternative routes.

usage_guideline.description: Use to annotate or classify educational or career trajectories that are disrupted, delayed, interrupted, or otherwise depart from standard patterns.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be applied where explicit documentation or evidence of deviation from normative pathway exists.

classes.name: NarrativeEpisode
classes.description: A discrete segment or portion of a personal narrative, oral history, or testimonial account, corresponding to a specific life event or period.

usage_guideline.description: Use to divide longer narratives, oral histories, or testimonies into identifiable segments directly relating to particular events or periods.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be mapped explicitly to related LifeEvent instances or specific periods. Not interchangeable with QualitativeAnnotation.

classes.name: Specialization
classes.description: A specific focus or concentration within a broader field of study or discipline that an individual pursues during an educational or professional trajectory.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent the major or concentrated area of academic or professional expertise pursued by a person. Specializations are often more specific than broad fields of study and may be nested within them.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used to capture distinct, named concentrations within recognized fields; link to FieldOfStudy or EducationEpisode as appropriate.

object_properties.name: hasLifeEvent
object_properties.description: Relates a person to a specific life event they have experienced.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate one or more life events with a person.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person may have multiple life events.

object_properties.name: occurredAtLocation
object_properties.description: Relates a life event to the geospatial location where it took place.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the location of a significant life event.
usage_guideline.constraints: A life event should be linked to at least one location.

object_properties.name: involvedPerson
object_properties.description: Relates a life event to a person who was involved in it.

usage_guideline.description: Use when the event involves people other than the primary subject (e.g., parents in a childbirth event, both partners in a marriage).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not duplicate information from the main hasLifeEvent property.

object_properties.name: relatesPerson
object_properties.description: Indicates the person to whom a family relationship applies (the related individual).

usage_guideline.description: Use to indicate the second person involved in a family relationship; the first person is represented by the subject.
usage_guideline.constraints: There must always be two persons involved in a family relationship.

object_properties.name: hasFamilyRelationship
object_properties.description: Associates a person with a family relationship they are a part of.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link a Person to explicit FamilyRelationship instances.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person may have multiple family relationships.

object_properties.name: isMemberOfTimeline
object_properties.description: Indicates that a life event is included within a given timeline.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate multiple life events to a timeline for visualization or reasoning.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each life event can be part of one or more timelines depicting different narrative perspectives.

object_properties.name: isConcurrentWith
object_properties.description: Indicates that two life events occurred with temporal overlap—either partially or fully—during an individual’s timeline.

usage_guideline.description: Use this property to explicitly link events that occurred at overlapping times (e.g., holding a job while attending school).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used for events belonging to the same individual or narrative.

object_properties.name: precedesEvent
object_properties.description: Denotes that one life event occurs before another event in a person’s timeline, establishing a temporal ordering.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to relate events in strict temporal sequence, supporting queries over event orderings.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not be used when explicit ordering is not known or is ambiguous; do not create circular chains.

object_properties.name: hasAffiliation
object_properties.description: Denotes a person’s formal or informal association with an organization or group, such as employers, academic institutions, or clubs.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to link persons to organizations or collectives with which they are connected (employment, membership, etc).
usage_guideline.constraints: Affiliation may be time-bound; details should be explicit where known.

object_properties.name: hasAffiliationPeriod
object_properties.description: Relates an affiliation between a person and an organization (or community group) to the calendar period during which the affiliation was valid or active.

usage_guideline.description: Apply when an affiliation is limited to a specific time interval—use with properties indicating start and end dates. Each time-bound membership should be modeled as a distinct relationship.
usage_guideline.constraints: Where known, both dates should be provided; use only the known endpoint if the full period is uncertain.

object_properties.name: heldAffiliationRole
object_properties.description: Identifies the role or title a person held in an organization or group during their affiliation period.

usage_guideline.description: Each instance of a person-organization affiliation may be linked to a specific role or multiple roles as appropriate. Roles help specify the nature of a person's participation.
