usage_guideline.constraints: Set as functional when the role is unique to a given affiliation period; allow multiples only if the modeling context requires tracking changes of role within a single continuous affiliation.

object_properties.name: documentsLifeEvent
object_properties.description: Links a source (document, record, testimony) to the life event(s) that it describes, documents, or attests to.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent the evidentiary connection from sources to the events they document. One source can document multiple events, and events can be documented by multiple sources.

object_properties.name: hasSocialRelationship
object_properties.description: Links a person to a specific social or professional relationship in which they participate (e.g., mentorship, friendship, collegial ties).

usage_guideline.description: Use for connecting each person involved in a non-familial relationship to the SocialRelationship instance.
usage_guideline.constraints: One SocialRelationship may include more than two persons if needed to represent a group.

object_properties.name: relatesPersonInSocialRelationship
object_properties.description: Indicates another person involved in a particular SocialRelationship.

usage_guideline.description: Use to list all individuals participating in a given social or professional relationship.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each SocialRelationship should reference all relevant parties.

object_properties.name: isPartOfSocialNetwork
object_properties.description: Indicates that a person is part of a larger social or professional network or grouping.

usage_guideline.description: Use this property to connect persons with the named or constructed social or professional networks to which they belong.
usage_guideline.constraints: Networks can be loosely or tightly defined, as appropriate to context.

object_properties.name: hasAuthorship
object_properties.description: Identifies the person or persons who authored a document or source.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly link documents or sources with their author(s).
usage_guideline.constraints: May have one or more authors. Do not use for editors, curators, or custodians unless these roles are clearly authors as well.

object_properties.name: hasCustodian
object_properties.description: Indicates the organization or individual responsible for the care, preservation, or custody of a document or source.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the current or historical custodian (such as an archive, institution, or individual) of a source or document.
usage_guideline.constraints: May reference organizations or persons; prefer organizational custodians for institutional records.

object_properties.name: isAccountOfPerson
object_properties.description: Indicates the individual whose life or experiences are documented in a specific testimony, autobiographical account, oral history, or narrative.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link testimony or narrative accounts to the subject individual. This allows distinguishing between testimonies given by different persons about different subjects.
usage_guideline.constraints: May be multiple persons if a testimony describes a group.

object_properties.name: isLinkedToMovement
object_properties.description: Relates a life event or a person to a major social, political, or cultural movement with which they were associated.

usage_guideline.description: Use this property to associate a person or an event with the movement(s) they participated in or were influenced by.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person or event may be linked to multiple movements; use clearly defined Movement instances as range.

object_properties.name: hasJobTitle
object_properties.description: Associates a life event such as employment or career role with the specific job title held by a person during that period.

usage_guideline.description: Use to indicate precisely which job title was held during an employment episode or significant career event.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each employment event should have only one job title per instance.

object_properties.name: hasEmployer
object_properties.description: Links a career-related life event to the employer (organization) associated with the position or employment.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to connect employment, career transition, or recognition events with the corresponding employer entity.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each event references a single employer; use additional instances for multiple concurrent employers.

object_properties.name: hasCareerRole
object_properties.description: Associates a person's specific role or function with a career-related life event.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify a role or set of duties a person performed during an employment or professional episode.
usage_guideline.constraints: Role should be relevant to the period/event modeled.

object_properties.name: hasCareerTransition
object_properties.description: Links a person or their timeline to a specific career transition event.

usage_guideline.description: Use to mark significant career changes or turning points in a person's trajectory.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple transitions may occur within a single career.

object_properties.name: hasUnemploymentPeriod
object_properties.description: Associates a person or their timeline with a period in which they were not employed.

usage_guideline.description: Use to highlight time intervals between jobs or careers.
usage_guideline.constraints: Applicable wherever unemployment episodes are relevant to career trajectory.

object_properties.name: hasRecognition
object_properties.description: Links a person or their timeline to a recognition event or award received.

usage_guideline.description: Use to document formal acknowledgments, awards, or honors in a person's history.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple recognitions may be linked.

object_properties.name: hasConsent
object_properties.description: Indicates that explicit consent has been granted regarding the use, sharing, or annotation of an individual's personal, biographical, or life history data.

usage_guideline.description: Use to denote formal, documented consent agreements regarding data usage.
usage_guideline.constraints: One consent relation per person per context; record relevant metadata via linked properties.

object_properties.name: grantedBy
object_properties.description: Identifies the agent (person or organization) who granted formal consent for a specific data usage, sharing, or annotation.

usage_guideline.description: Use to make explicit the source of authorization for a given consent.
usage_guideline.constraints: Consent must be associated with one, and only one, granter per instance.

object_properties.name: hasLifeNarrative
object_properties.description: Associates a person with an overarching life narrative or biographical storyline that summarizes or contextualizes their life history.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link an individual to synthesized biographical or narrative accounts describing their life in thematic or holistic terms.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple narratives may exist for a single person (e.g., multiple biographies or thematic interpretations).

object_properties.name: contextualizesEvent
object_properties.description: Relates a life narrative or qualitative annotation to the specific life event(s) it contextualizes, interprets, or supplements.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly identify which LifeEvent(s) are being contextualized or interpreted by a particular narrative or annotation.
usage_guideline.constraints: A narrative or annotation may contextualize one or multiple events.

object_properties.name: hasQualitativeAnnotation
object_properties.description: Links a life event or life narrative to one or more qualitative annotations providing contextual or interpretive commentary.

usage_guideline.description: Use to attach textual or interpretive notes to events or narratives for richer, nuanced representation.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple annotations may apply. Distinct from uncertainty notes, which specifically address incomplete or ambiguous information.

object_properties.name: isAssociatedWithEvent
object_properties.description: Links a digital artifact to the life event or episode with which it is associated.

usage_guideline.description: Use to trace the evidentiary or contextual relationship between a digital artifact (e.g., photo, certificate) and a specific event in a person's life.
usage_guideline.constraints: Artifacts may be associated with multiple events if relevant; each association should be explicit.

object_properties.name: hasPrivacyRestriction
object_properties.description: Links a person or their associated data to a specific privacy restriction applied to that data.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate explicit privacy rules, restrictions, or flagged limitations with individual-level data or records.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple restrictions can be associated with a single person; combine with consent mechanisms where required.

object_properties.name: hasSensitiveInformation
object_properties.description: Indicates that a person, life event, or digital artifact contains or is marked as sensitive information requiring special handling.

usage_guideline.description: Use to flag specific records, events, or digital objects that are recognized as especially sensitive or requiring protection.
usage_guideline.constraints: Apply only where special risk, confidentiality, or protection status is justified.

object_properties.name: isGovernedByAccessControlPolicy
object_properties.description: Specifies that a person, digital artifact, or life event is subject to a particular access control policy.

usage_guideline.description: Apply this property to connect data or artifacts to the concrete access control configuration or policy governing their handling.
usage_guideline.constraints: An instance may be governed by multiple policies if applicable, such as layered or hierarchical controls.

object_properties.name: mapsGeographically
object_properties.description: Indicates the linkage between a life event and its representation via geographic mapping (such as geocoordinates, regions, or map visualizations).

usage_guideline.description: Use when associating a life event with its detailed geographic mapping or coordinates, supporting spatial reasoning or visualization.
usage_guideline.constraints: May be used alongside occurredAtLocation for events covering multiple mapped points, routes, or areas.

object_properties.name: mapsTemporally
object_properties.description: Links a life event or series of events to a temporal sequence, timeline, or periodization scheme for mapping them in time.

usage_guideline.description: Use to support advanced temporal mapping, sequencing, or visualization of life event histories.
usage_guideline.constraints: Intended for temporal analysis or when events are part of a narrative time map.

object_properties.name: hasImpactOnLifeEvent
object_properties.description: Specifies that a disruption event (environmental, economic, societal) has an effect on one or more life events or milestones experienced by a person.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent explicit impact or causal linkage from a disruption event to subsequent or contingent life events (e.g., a pandemic causing an interruption in education).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should link only when there is a evidenced or narratively relevant connection.

object_properties.name: hasAnnotation
object_properties.description: Relates a life event, life narrative, or person to one or more annotations, semantic tags, or commentaries that enrich or clarify the underlying data.

usage_guideline.description: Use this property to link biographical entities to enrichment annotations, semantic tags, or scholarly commentaries on life data.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple annotations may be associated with any entity. Use for structured, enriched, or semantic tagging beyond qualitative commentary.

object_properties.name: hasVerificationStatus
object_properties.description: Specifies the verification or evidentiary status of a life event, annotation, or life narrative entry, based on available sources or assessment.

usage_guideline.description: Assign to indicate the evidentiary confidence or validation of a given entry, annotation, or event. Supports data quality queries and evidence-based filtering.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each item should have one verification status if assessed; omit only if status is unknown.

object_properties.name: hasEducationEpisode
object_properties.description: Links a person to a specific education episode representing a discrete part of their educational trajectory.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate each person with the full set of educational episodes they have experienced.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person may have multiple education episodes throughout their life.

object_properties.name: isEnrolledInProgram
object_properties.description: Specifies the program in which a person or education episode is enrolled.

usage_guideline.description: Use to indicate the specific program a person followed during an education episode.
usage_guideline.constraints: One program per education episode; model multiple separate episodes if an individual changes program.

object_properties.name: isAtInstitution
object_properties.description: Indicates the institution where an education episode takes place.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly connect each education episode to the school, college, or university attended.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each education episode should be linked to one primary institution; for joint/dual programs, model as separate episodes.

object_properties.name: hasFieldOfStudy
object_properties.description: Links an education episode or program to its principal field of study.

usage_guideline.description: Use for representing the area/discipline associated with the education episode or program.
usage_guideline.constraints: One primary field per episode/program; use additional properties if significant multi-disciplinary study occurs.

object_properties.name: receivedCredential
object_properties.description: Relates an education episode where a credential, diploma, or degree was awarded upon completion.

usage_guideline.description: Link an education episode to the formal credential received (if any) at its conclusion.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only use if a credential was in fact conferred; leave blank if no credential awarded.

object_properties.name: hasMentorship
object_properties.description: Links a person to a mentorship relationship in which they are either mentor or mentee.

usage_guideline.description: Associate a person with each mentorship relation in which they participate, regardless of their role.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each mentorship should reference at least two persons (mentor and mentee).

object_properties.name: hasMentor
object_properties.description: Indicates the person fulfilling the mentor role in a mentorship relationship.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the primary mentor in a mentorship instance.
usage_guideline.constraints: One mentor per mentorship instance. Model group/peer mentoring as multiple mentorships if needed.

object_properties.name: hasMentee
object_properties.description: Indicates the person receiving mentorship and guidance in a mentorship relationship.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the primary mentee or beneficiary in a mentorship instance.
usage_guideline.constraints: One mentee per mentorship instance. Model multiple mentees as distinct mentorships if necessary.

object_properties.name: hasSocioEconomicStatusChange
object_properties.description: Links a person to a specific change or transition in their socio-economic status, facilitating modeling of status evolution over the life course.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent key points where a person's socio-economic status shifted (e.g., upward or downward mobility).
usage_guideline.constraints: Only use when status change is significant and can be substantiated.

object_properties.name: hasLegalEvent
object_properties.description: Associates a person with a legal event that has affected their identity or life trajectory.

usage_guideline.description: Use to connect each person to the legal events in which they have participated or been affected.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person may be associated with multiple legal events.

object_properties.name: hasCareerMilestone
object_properties.description: Links a person to significant achievements, positions, or other notable milestones in their career history.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent major points in a person's professional development, such as promotions, appointments, awards, or transitions.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person may have multiple career milestones; use only for milestones of major relevance.

object_properties.name: hasArchivalStatus
object_properties.description: Specifies the archival status of a record element, such as active, archived, or uncertain.

usage_guideline.description: Associate each record element with its current archival status using controlled values for consistency.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should have at most one status per record element at a given time.

object_properties.name: isRecordElementOf
object_properties.description: Relates a record element to the person whom the record concerns.

usage_guideline.description: Use to indicate which person a given record element belongs to or describes.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each record element should be linked to a specific person.

object_properties.name: hasMigrationPathway
object_properties.description: Links a person to their migration pathway, which encodes multi-stage movement, origins, destinations, and associated events.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate an individual with their overall migration trajectory, as distinct from a single migration event.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person may have zero or more migration pathways.

object_properties.name: hasOrigin
object_properties.description: Specifies the starting location of a migration pathway or episode.

usage_guideline.description: Use to indicate the geographic starting point of a migration trajectory.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only one origin per migration pathway.

object_properties.name: hasDestination
object_properties.description: Specifies the final or target location reached at the end of a migration pathway or episode.

usage_guideline.description: Indicate the intended or arrived-at location for each migration pathway.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only one primary destination should be modeled; for multi-stage/destinations, use additional pathways.

object_properties.name: includesRelocationEpisode
object_properties.description: Links a migration pathway to specific episodes of relocation or resettlement that comprise it.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate each migration pathway with the set of relocation or resettlement events that are part of it.
usage_guideline.constraints: A pathway may include multiple relocations or resettlements; list each episode separately.

object_properties.name: hasHouseholdComposition
object_properties.description: Links a person or timeline to a specific household composition present at a given time.

usage_guideline.description: Use to indicate the household(s) an individual is part of at specific times or in particular periods.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple compositions may be linked to a person or timeline if they change over time.

object_properties.name: hasLivingArrangement
object_properties.description: Associates a person or timeline with a particular living arrangement or context at a given time.

usage_guideline.description: Use to describe current or historical living contexts for an individual.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person may have multiple living arrangements through their life history.

object_properties.name: isMemberOfHousehold
object_properties.description: Indicates that a person is a member of a given household composition at a point in time.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model membership of a person in a household for the relevant composition instance.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple persons may be members of one household; a person may be member of different households at different times.

object_properties.name: hasSensitivePersonalData
object_properties.description: Indicates that a person or record element contains or references sensitive personal information requiring heightened protection.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link a person or their record elements to specific sensitive data types for privacy and compliance management.
usage_guideline.constraints: Apply only where data meets the domain or regulatory definition of sensitive personal data.

object_properties.name: isManagedByPrivacyMechanism
object_properties.description: Specifies the privacy management mechanism in use for a given sensitive data item, person, or record element.

usage_guideline.description: Link sensitive information or blocks of personal data to the policy, technical, or procedural mechanism governing its privacy management.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple mechanisms may apply to a single data item; record associations as appropriate.

object_properties.name: isGovernedByEthicalGuideline
object_properties.description: Relates a consent, privacy restriction, or sensitive personal data to the ethical guideline or framework governing its handling.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record reference to one or more ethical codes or guidelines applicable to the data's management.
usage_guideline.constraints: Reference only external, recognized ethical codes or standards.

object_properties.name: tagsEntityWithQualitativeTag
object_properties.description: Associates an entity (person, record, event, or narrative) with one or more qualitative tags for thematic enrichment and qualitative analysis.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link various entities to qualitative tags reflecting interpretive content, theme, or analyst’s perspective.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple tags permitted per entity; do not duplicate structured annotation. Intended for unstructured qualitative tagging or coding.

object_properties.name: hasNonFormalLearningExperience
object_properties.description: Links a person to an organized, structured, non-formal learning experience they participated in during their life trajectory.

usage_guideline.description: Use to capture a comprehensive learning history. Link to provider, topic, and result where available.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple non-formal episodes can be modeled for a person. Distinct from formal EducationEpisode and informal learning.

object_properties.name: hasInformalLearningExperience
object_properties.description: Associates a person with an informal learning experience or episode relevant to their educational trajectory.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to model non-structured, lived, or social/community-based learning events. Record context, source, or topic if possible.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple informal episodes may be present; use for learning not otherwise categorized.

object_properties.name: hasOfficialIdentifier
object_properties.description: Links a person to an official identifier, such as a national ID, passport number, or similar authentication reference.

usage_guideline.description: Use for recording government-issued or authoritative identifiers for individuals.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple identifiers may be associated with a single person if applicable.

object_properties.name: hasPhotograph
object_properties.description: Links a person to a digital artifact or record representing their photograph, portrait, or likeness.

usage_guideline.description: Use for associating photographs with biographical records; distinguish by artifact type if necessary.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only include images providing personal identification or biographical relevance.

object_properties.name: hasDemographicAttribute
object_properties.description: Associates a person with a specific demographic attribute record (such as gender, ethnicity, nationality, etc).

usage_guideline.description: Use for explicit modeling when details or sources of demographic assignment need to be referenced or traced.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple demographic attributes may be associated with a person.

object_properties.name: hasMembershipStatus
object_properties.description: States the status of a person's affiliation or membership in an organization, association, or community group.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to encode a person’s current or historic membership status in a group/organization context.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use distinct instances for each organization, period, or role; status may change over time.

object_properties.name: isContextualizedBy
object_properties.description: Associates a life milestone, life event, or other biographical element with an environmental or contextual factor (e.g., traditions, regional events, disruptions) relevant to its interpretation.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to make explicit the contextual influences shaping or affecting a life event or milestone.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple contextual factors may relate to a single event.

object_properties.name: alignsWithMilestone
object_properties.description: Relates an environmental or contextual factor (such as a regional event or tradition) to a specific milestone in a person’s life history that it aligns with or influences.

usage_guideline.description: Use for modeling the alignment or overlap of contextual events/traditions with significant biographical milestones.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple alignments may be possible; should be used when the correspondence is historically or narratively meaningful.

object_properties.name: hasDataAccessRecord
object_properties.description: Associates a person or their life history data with a specific data access record.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link individuals to records of who has accessed their data.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple access records may exist per person.

object_properties.name: wasAccessedBy
object_properties.description: Indicates the agent (person or organization) who accessed the individual's data, as captured in a data access record.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record the accessing party per access event.
usage_guideline.constraints: One agent per DataAccessRecord.

object_properties.name: isLinkedToConsent
object_properties.description: Indicates the specific Consent record under which a data access record was authorized.

usage_guideline.description: Connect each instance of DataAccessRecord to the Consent authorizing the access.
usage_guideline.constraints: One consent per access; required for compliance tracking.

object_properties.name: hasNameHistory
object_properties.description: Links a person to their record(s) of historical names.

usage_guideline.description: Use to reference all instances of a person's names used at different times.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple NameHistory instances per individual are permitted.

object_properties.name: hasLegalStatusHistory
object_properties.description: Links a person to their history of legal statuses.

usage_guideline.description: Use for associating a person with all legal statuses held during their life.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple histories can coexist if statuses changed repeatedly.

object_properties.name: hasIdentifierHistory
object_properties.description: Links a person to historical records of their official identifiers.

usage_guideline.description: Use to reference all former and current official identifiers for an individual.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple IdentifierHistory records per person allowed.

object_properties.name: wasTriggeredByEvent
object_properties.description: Links a NameHistory, LegalStatusHistory, or IdentifierHistory record to the LifeEvent or LegalEvent that prompted the change.

usage_guideline.description: Use to declare the event responsible for changes to names, statuses, or identifiers.
usage_guideline.constraints: One causative event per change record.

object_properties.name: hasStatusIndicator
object_properties.description: Associates a record element or data point in a person's life story with a status indicator describing its current state or reliability.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record or track the status (e.g., 'active', 'archived', etc.) of individual data elements in biographical or life history records.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only one status indicator per record element at a time; do not use for entire person or event classes.

object_properties.name: grantsConsentPermission
object_properties.description: Indicates that a consent record grants a specific permission or access condition regarding the use or sharing of personal life history data.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link each consent with the specific permissions or access rights it provides.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple permissions may be granted per consent; each permission should describe a distinct right or condition.

object_properties.name: isOrderedInSequence
object_properties.description: Indicates that an education episode or institution occurs at a specific position in an educational sequence, supporting explicit chronological ordering.

usage_guideline.description: Apply this property to relate an EducationEpisode or Institution to its containing EducationalSequence. Sequencing order should be specified using position or ordering data property.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use alongside hasSequenceOrder where explicit order/index is needed.

object_properties.name: complementsFormalEducation
object_properties.description: Indicates that an informal learning experience supplements or enhances a person's formal educational trajectory.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly relate informal learning experiences to formal EducationEpisodes they complement, extend, or enhance.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple informal learning experiences may complement the same formal episode; relation should be used where the complementary nature is evidenced or asserted.

object_properties.name: hasIntersectionalContext
object_properties.description: Associates a person, life event, or biographical episode with a defined intersectional context, capturing the interplay of multiple identity factors or statuses.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly link persons or life events to the intersectional contexts that have shaped, constrained, or informed their experiences. Especially relevant for representing multicultural, minority, or overlapping identity factors.
usage_guideline.constraints: An entity may have multiple intersectional contexts; each association should reference a distinct set of intersecting identities or statuses.

object_properties.name: hasTemporalDetail
object_properties.description: Links a migration, relocation, or travel event to its associated temporal details (e.g., timing, sequence, duration patterns).

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent complex temporal information for movement events—such as recurring migrations, staggered moves, or overlapping durations.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not duplicate basic event dates/durations; use only for cases requiring supplementary temporal analysis.

object_properties.name: hasSpatialDetail
object_properties.description: Links a migration, relocation, or travel event to its associated spatial details, including mapped routes, regions traversed, or spatial patterns.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to associate spatial annotations, details, or route information with a mobility event, supporting richer geospatial queries or representations.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use in addition to, not in place of, occurredAtLocation or mapsGeographically; appropriate for complex mobility involving multiple locations or nuanced spatial patterns.

object_properties.name: isInMulticulturalContext
object_properties.description: Links a person or a life event to a multicultural context that shapes or is reflected in their biography.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to indicate the relevance of multicultural experience, participation, or identity for a given person or event.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple such contexts may be linked if distinct multicultural experiences are present.

object_properties.name: hasCurationAction
object_properties.description: Associates a record element or life history record with the specific curation action(s) performed on it.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link each record element to the actions that authored, curated, or modified it.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple curation actions may apply to a record element; each action should reference its performer and timestamp.

object_properties.name: performedBy
object_properties.description: Identifies the agent, such as a person or organization, who performed a curation action on a record.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record the specific person or organization responsible for a curation action (authorship, curation, modification) on a record.
usage_guideline.constraints: Exactly one agent per curation action.

object_properties.name: providedSelfNarrative
object_properties.description: Indicates that a person has provided a self-narrative or autobiographical account capturing their perspective on key events, roles, or transitions.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate an individual with self-authored narratives about their own experiences.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple self-narratives are allowed, such as about different periods or themes in a person’s life.

object_properties.name: reflectsOnIdentity
object_properties.description: Denotes that an affiliation, relationship, or narrative reflects or impacts a person’s identity, opportunities, or life outcomes.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to capture cases where the nature or structure of affiliations/relationships is explicitly said to influence or reflect a person’s sense of self, opportunities, or outcomes.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used when a relation, role, or narrative has documented or asserted impact on identity or opportunities.

object_properties.name: affectsLifeOutcome
object_properties.description: Indicates that an affiliation or relationship has a documented effect on the opportunities, transitions, or outcomes in a person's life.

usage_guideline.description: Use when affiliations or relationships are analytically or narratively linked to changes or opportunities in a person's life course (e.g., access to educational opportunities, career advancement).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should not be used for generic relationships unless their impact is clearly established or asserted.

object_properties.name: hasLifePhase
object_properties.description: Associates a person or a timeline with a distinct life phase experienced over their biography.

usage_guideline.description: Use to indicate the presence and delineation of major life phases within a person’s life history.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person or timeline may have multiple life phases, some of which may overlap.

object_properties.name: hasTransition
object_properties.description: Links a person, timeline, or life phase to a specific transition event marking a significant change in life status, arrangement, or phase.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record significant passages or turning points between phases, arrangements, or statuses in a life course.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple transitions can occur in the life of an individual; transitions should be explicitly delimited by relevant events or context.

object_properties.name: isPrecededByPhase
object_properties.description: Denotes that one life phase follows directly after another on a person’s timeline.

usage_guideline.description: Use to define the sequential order of life phases in a chronology.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only use where the transition from one phase to the next is defined; do not create loops or circularities.

object_properties.name: visualizedOnMap
object_properties.description: Indicates that a life phase, life event, or transition is represented or visualized in a geospatial mapping context.

usage_guideline.description: Use when associating a life phase, event, or transition with its depiction or representation in geographic form (e.g., on a migration or event map).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used for map-based visualization or geospatial analysis scenarios.

object_properties.name: hasGroupParticipation
object_properties.description: Links a person to a GroupParticipation episode, representing their involvement in volunteer, advocacy, or cultural groups.

usage_guideline.description: Associate each person with episodes of engagement in advocacy, cultural, or volunteer groups; allows documentation of periods, roles, and the evolution of participation.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple participations per person allowed; use when involvement is distinctive enough to record.

object_properties.name: participatedInGroup
object_properties.description: Indicates the group (e.g., volunteer, advocacy, or cultural group) with which a given GroupParticipation episode is associated.

usage_guideline.description: Specify the particular group or association connected to each participation episode.
usage_guideline.constraints: One group per participation period; model multiple GroupParticipation instances for repeated or multi-group involvement.

object_properties.name: heldRoleInGroup
object_properties.description: Identifies the specific role that a person held during their participation in a group, as represented in a GroupParticipation episode.

usage_guideline.description: Use to indicate the person's particular responsibility or function for each period of involvement.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only one primary role per episode; use additional GroupParticipation if roles changed substantially.

object_properties.name: hasParticipationImplication
object_properties.description: Links a GroupParticipation or LegalEvent to its implication(s), namely changes, outcomes, or effects resulting from the event or participation.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record the effects, changes, or outcomes of relevant legal, civic, or group participation events.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple implications may be linked if more than one outcome is documented.

object_properties.name: hasPersonalNarrative
object_properties.description: Associates a person with one or more PersonalNarrative accounts (oral histories, testimonies, etc.) documenting their life experience.

usage_guideline.description: Link each person to their available personal narratives, which may be multilingual or reflect various cultural frameworks.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple narratives per person allowed; each narrative instance should be unique.

object_properties.name: hasNarrativeTranslation
object_properties.description: Relates a PersonalNarrative to its available translations/adaptations in other languages or cultural frameworks.

usage_guideline.description: Use to reference all alternate language or culturally adapted versions of a narrative.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple translations per narrative allowed; each translation should specify language and relevant adaptation.

object_properties.name: attachsArtifactToLifeHistory
object_properties.description: Links an attachment (e.g., as specified record, document, or digital artifact) to the person’s overarching life history or biography, indicating explicit inclusion or support.

usage_guideline.description: Use this property to indicate that an artifact, source, or document is attached to the life history of a specific person as supporting evidence or narrative supplement.
usage_guideline.constraints: Link each Attachment to exactly one Person's life history for explicit, non-ambiguous association.

object_properties.name: attachesArtifact
object_properties.description: Relates an attachment to the actual digital artifact (e.g., photo, video, audio, scanned document) or source being attached.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify which digital artifact, multimedia item, or record is included via the Attachment for a person’s life history.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each Attachment may reference one or more DigitalArtifact instances; use distinct Attachment instances if needed for diverse artifact types.

object_properties.name: isAttachmentOf
object_properties.description: Relates a digital artifact, source, or annotation to its role as an attachment within a person's life history.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the inverse relation: that a given artifact is present as an attachment for a life history or timeline record.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be used for navigation/querying from artifact to its usage context.

object_properties.name: verifiesLifeHistoryInformation
object_properties.description: Indicates that a source (such as official record, document, or institutional record) is used to verify specific content or facts in a person’s life history.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to encode evidentiary or verification relationships between a source and the aspects of a person's life history it confirms or attests. Supports traceability and reliability modeling.
usage_guideline.constraints: Sources may verify all or part of a person’s life history; specify the scope in annotation if partial.

object_properties.name: hasAnnotationForPeriodOrEvent
object_properties.description: Links an annotation, qualitative code, or commentary to a particular period or event in a person's life history, enabling fine-grained qualitative enrichment.

usage_guideline.description: Use for associating interpretive notes or qualitative codes to particular life events or time-bounded periods (not just the entire biography). May be used in coding/analysis workflows.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each Annotation should specify the directly contextualized LifeEvent(s) or defined period; multiple annotations per event/period are permitted.

object_properties.name: hasLanguageProficiency
object_properties.description: Associates a person with their specific proficiency record in a given language.

usage_guideline.description: Use to list all language proficiencies a person holds; link to specific Language instances and context.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple language proficiencies may be recorded per person.

object_properties.name: inLanguage
object_properties.description: Indicates the language to which a language proficiency record applies.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate a language proficiency with its specific natural language.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each LanguageProficiency instance should reference exactly one Language.

object_properties.name: hasReasonForInterruption
object_properties.description: Links a life event representing an interruption (e.g., career break, sabbatical, unemployment) to the reason or explanation for that period.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly state why an interruption or break in career/employment occurred.
usage_guideline.constraints: One reason per interruption instance; use controlled vocabularies if possible.

object_properties.name: hasReligiousAffiliation
object_properties.description: Associates a Person with their religious affiliation during a specific period of their life.

usage_guideline.description: Use to capture periods or contexts in which a person identified with, participated in, or was recognized as belonging to a particular religion or denomination.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person may have multiple ReligiousAffiliation instances over their life, each with distinct time periods or contexts.

object_properties.name: hasLanguageUseContext
object_properties.description: Connects a LanguageProficiency record to the context(s) in which a person uses a language.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the setting or situation (e.g., home, work, community) in which a language is used by the person.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple LanguageUseContext instances may apply to one LanguageProficiency.

object_properties.name: hasCareerMilestoneType
object_properties.description: Specifies the type of career milestone for a CareerMilestone instance.

usage_guideline.description: Use to describe distinctly whether a career milestone is an employment, recognition, promotion, demotion, or unemployment.
usage_guideline.constraints: Assign exactly one type per CareerMilestone; extend type list with care to avoid overlap.

object_properties.name: hasPreferredName
object_properties.description: Associates a person with their preferred name, distinct from legal or birth names.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link an individual to their current or historically declared preferred name. One value per period is typical; use multiple instances if preference changed over time.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should only be used when the preferred name is distinct and explicitly designated.

object_properties.name: hasAlias
object_properties.description: Links a person to one or more aliases or alternative names they have used.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to capture alternative, informal, or community names used by an individual. Can be repeated for multiple aliases; useful for mapping digital identities, stage names, or nicknames.
usage_guideline.constraints: Do not use for legal names or preferred names unless used separately as aliases.

object_properties.name: hasMultimediaArtifact
object_properties.description: Links a person or a life event to a specific multimedia artifact, such as a photograph, video, or audio file, that is relevant to their life history.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate people or events directly with evidentiary or illustrative multimedia materials for enrichment, validation, or illustration.
usage_guideline.constraints: May associate multiple artifacts per person or event; does not replace source or attachment classes.

object_properties.name: hasLicense
object_properties.description: Associates a person with a license, legal authorization, or formal permit they possess or have possessed.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link individuals to licenses or legal authorizations they have held. Multiple licenses may be associated with a single person if applicable.
usage_guideline.constraints: Does not duplicate official identifiers; only use for legal permissions or credentials.

object_properties.name: hasAncestryDetail
object_properties.description: Associates a person with documented details of their ancestry or genealogical background.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link a person with structured or narrative details about their familial origins or known lineage.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple ancestry details can be provided for different aspects of lineage, as supported by documentation.

object_properties.name: hasIntergenerationalConnection
object_properties.description: Indicates explicit intergenerational links or patterns relevant to a person’s ancestry, family relationship, or historical lineage.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model cross-generational relationships of genealogical or social significance, such as multi-generational influence or patterns.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should specify the generational span or type of connection.

object_properties.name: heldEmploymentPeriod
object_properties.description: Links a person to a specific employment period or job episode, recording the period, position, employer, and location.

usage_guideline.description: Use to enumerate each job, position, or professional role a person has held as part of their occupational history.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple employment periods per person are permitted; each distinct job/role should be a separate instance.

object_properties.name: hasGeographicContext
object_properties.description: Associates a life event, employment period, or professional role with relevant geographic context or environment.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to give context for events or jobs where the geographic region or setting is analytically or narratively significant.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use when the place or geographic circumstance adds interpretive value distinct from specific occurredAtLocation.

object_properties.name: isContextualizedByCulturalContext
object_properties.description: Indicates that a life event, employment period, or significant biography segment is interpreted or understood within a specific cultural, religious, or linguistic context.

usage_guideline.description: Use when events or roles must be contextualized within the person’s cultural/religious/linguistic identity for accurate interpretation.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use only for cases where the contextual factor is explicitly relevant to event or trajectory analysis.

object_properties.name: hasNameType
object_properties.description: Indicates the category or type of a name used by a person within a NameHistory record, such as legal name, preferred name, or alias.

usage_guideline.description: Assign a single NameType category to each NameHistory record to enable distinctions among legal, preferred, alias, and other name usages.
usage_guideline.constraints: Exactly one NameType per NameHistory instance. Controlled values should be maintained for interoperability.

object_properties.name: hasAward
object_properties.description: Indicates that a person has received a specific formal award or honor.

usage_guideline.description: Apply to link individuals to formal awards or honors they have received, representing institutional or organizational recognition.
usage_guideline.constraints: May be repeated for multiple awards; should only link to formal, documented awards.

object_properties.name: hasInformalAchievement
object_properties.description: Denotes a person's receipt or accomplishment of a notable informal recognition or achievement.

usage_guideline.description: Link individuals to informal but relevant achievements or recognitions in their biography.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple achievements possible per person; use only for significant, contextually meaningful recognitions.

object_properties.name: awardedBy
object_properties.description: Identifies the awarding body, organization, or authority responsible for granting a particular award to a person.

usage_guideline.description: Use to tie each award instance to the specific entity that conferred it.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each award should reference a single awarding body; use additional properties if joint awarding occurs.

object_properties.name: annotationAttachedToElement
object_properties.description: Relates an AnnotationAttachment to the structured biographical data element (e.g., life event, social relationship, affiliation, record segment) it supplements or comments on.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the target of an annotation or commentary attachment. Enables rich semantic and interpretive integration with structured data.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only one primary target per attachment; use additional instances for multi-target attachments.

object_properties.name: heldRoleInMembership
object_properties.description: Indicates the specific formal or informal role a person held during a group or network membership episode.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the capacity in which a person participated (e.g., member, moderator, leader) during a distinct membership period.
usage_guideline.constraints: One primary role per GroupMembership instance; specify multiple memberships if the role changed over time.

object_properties.name: hasMembershipStatusInMembership
object_properties.description: Denotes the status of a person's membership within a group or network during a specific membership episode (e.g., active, honorary, former).

usage_guideline.description: Assign to GroupMembership to distinguish between active, former, or other status per episode.
usage_guideline.constraints: Controlled vocabulary for status terms preferred; one status per GroupMembership instance.

object_properties.name: documentsGroupMembership
object_properties.description: Links a Source or Testimony to evidence or documentation of a person's membership or participation in a group or network.

usage_guideline.description: Use to reference the documentary or testimonial evidence supporting or attesting to group or network membership.
usage_guideline.constraints: One Source/Testimony may document multiple GroupMemberships, and each GroupMembership may be documented by multiple sources.

object_properties.name: isMemberOfGroupMembership
object_properties.description: Links a Person to a specific GroupMembership episode in which they participated.

usage_guideline.description: Use in preference to generic membership properties for cases requiring explicit modeling of group participation histories with role, status, and time.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use one instance per group membership period per person; do not use to link to organizations or community groups directly unless the GroupMembership context is explicitly modeled.

object_properties.name: isMembershipInGroup
object_properties.description: Associates a GroupMembership episode with the Organization, CommunityGroup, or InformalNetwork to which the membership applies.

usage_guideline.description: Specify the group, organization, or network associated with the membership record.
usage_guideline.constraints: Must only reference one group per GroupMembership instance; select the most specific type available.

object_properties.name: hasLineageRecord
object_properties.description: Associates a person with a specific lineage record capturing ancestral relationships or lines of descent.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link individuals to their documented genealogical or ancestral lineages.
usage_guideline.constraints: A person may have multiple lineage records if documented through different descent lines or community ties.

object_properties.name: isAncestorInLineage
object_properties.description: Identifies a person as an ancestor within a given lineage record.

usage_guideline.description: Use to designate which person(s) are considered ancestors within a particular lineage record.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple ancestors may be linked to a single LineageRecord, denoting lineage origin or important generational links.

object_properties.name: isDescendantInLineage
object_properties.description: Indicates a person as a descendant within a given lineage record.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify which person(s) are identified as descendants in a particular documented lineage.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple descendants may be linked to one LineageRecord when modeling extended lineages or branching genealogies.

object_properties.name: hasProfessionalRecognition
object_properties.description: Associates a person with a professional recognition event or milestone they have received.

usage_guideline.description: Link a person to all formal and informal professional recognitions received during their career.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple recognitions per person may be recorded.

object_properties.name: hasCertificationAchievement
object_properties.description: Links a person to a professional certification achievement that they have obtained.

usage_guideline.description: Use for connecting individuals to completed, valid career-related certifications as part of their professional record.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple certifications possible per person.

object_properties.name: hasInformalProfessionalAchievement
object_properties.description: Associates a person with a notable informal achievement within their professional or career context.

usage_guideline.description: Link to informal, contextually significant career achievements not covered by awards or certifications.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple instances can be recorded per individual.

object_properties.name: hasChronologicalSequence
object_properties.description: Links a Timeline, LifeEvent, or PersonalNarrative to its explicit chronological sequence, enabling reasoning over temporal order.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate entities with their explicit chronological order or sequence. Especially relevant when sequencing spans narrative and event datasets.
usage_guideline.constraints: A single entity may belong to multiple sequences, but each sequence should have a clearly defined order.

object_properties.name: hasGeographicMapping
object_properties.description: Connects a Timeline, LifeEvent, or NarrativeEpisode with its associated GeographicMapping, supporting mapped visualizations and spatial queries.

usage_guideline.description: Use to enable spatial representation and analysis of event or narrative elements when mapped to locations or regions.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each mapping should reference all relevant events or narrative episodes for accurate visualization.

object_properties.name: hasNarrativeEpisode
object_properties.description: Associates a PersonalNarrative, Testimony, or OralHistory with its constituent NarrativeEpisodes.

usage_guideline.description: Use to explicitly subdivide narrative accounts into distinct episodes for fine-grained mapping to events or timelines.
usage_guideline.constraints: A narrative may comprise multiple episodes; map each episode to relevant LifeEvent or period where applicable.

object_properties.name: isNonTraditionalPathwayOf
object_properties.description: Indicates that a NonTraditionalPathway is associated with a given EducationEpisode, CareerInterruption, or Timeline, documenting deviations from normative progression.

usage_guideline.description: Use to annotate or link educational/career episodes that are categorized as non-standard, interrupted, or non-linear.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each NonTraditionalPathway instance should reference the affected period or event.

object_properties.name: hasSpecialization
object_properties.description: Links an EducationEpisode or Program to the specialization that was pursued during that period.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the detailed academic or professional specialization associated with a formal education episode or structured program.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each EducationEpisode or Program instance should have at most one primary specialization; use multiple relationships only if the context supports multiple concurrent specializations.

object_properties.name: birthPlace
object_properties.description: Specifies the location at which a person was born.

usage_guideline.description: Use this property to identify the specific place of birth for an individual.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each person should have at most one birth place recorded; link to an existing Location instance.

data_properties.name: occurredOnDate
data_properties.description: Specifies the calendar date when a life event occurred.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the date of a life event.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each life event should have exactly one associated date.

data_properties.name: relationshipType
data_properties.description: Specifies the concrete nature of a family relationship (e.g., parent, child, sibling, spouse, step, adoptive, chosen family, extended family, etc.).

usage_guideline.description: Identify the kind of family relationship, using controlled vocabulary if possible.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each FamilyRelationship instance should have one specific type.

data_properties.name: hasAgeAtEvent
data_properties.description: Specifies the age of the person at the time a particular life event occurred.

usage_guideline.description: Specify the age (in years) at which the person experienced the event.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use integer values; applicable when age at event is of interest or available.

data_properties.name: hasUncertaintyNote
data_properties.description: Provides a textual explanation or annotation about the uncertainty, ambiguity, or incomplete nature of a particular life event.

usage_guideline.description: Attach a brief summary explaining why a LifeEvent’s data are uncertain, such as missing dates, ambiguous involvement, or alternative interpretations.
usage_guideline.constraints: Intended for free-text notes; should be used where uncertainty is relevant.

data_properties.name: uncertaintyLevel
data_properties.description: Represents the degree or severity of uncertainty associated with a LifeEvent, typically encoded as a controlled value (e.g., ‘high’, ‘moderate’, ‘low’).

usage_guideline.description: Specify the uncertainty level for a LifeEvent instance, ideally using a standardized set of terms.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use controlled vocabulary and ensure consistency across events; optional where information is certain.

data_properties.name: hasPeriodDuration
data_properties.description: Specifies the duration in days, months, or years that a life event or period lasted.

usage_guideline.description: Use ISO 8601 duration format (e.g., 'P3Y' for three years) when possible. Useful for education, career, or migration episodes with known start and end.
usage_guideline.constraints: Duration should be recorded where both start and end are known or can be reasonably estimated.

data_properties.name: hasEventStartDate
data_properties.description: Indicates the calendar date on which a life event began, when the event has duration.

usage_guideline.description: Use for events or periods with both start and end dates (e.g., multi-year employment).
usage_guideline.constraints: Must not be used if event is instantaneous or only the end date is known.

data_properties.name: hasEventEndDate
data_properties.description: Indicates the calendar date on which a life event ended, where applicable.

usage_guideline.description: Use for delimiting the conclusion of an event with a known end point (e.g., end of education, end of migration period).
usage_guideline.constraints: Not required for instantaneous events or those with uncertain end.

data_properties.name: hasSocioEconomicStatus
data_properties.description: Describes a person's socio-economic status during a particular life period or event, such as class, occupation, or other stratification.

usage_guideline.description: Use for textual, controlled, or coded descriptions of socio-economic status at a given time. May be applied separately to multiple periods using event-related context.
usage_guideline.constraints: Choose a consistent taxonomy or encoding scheme if available (e.g., 'working class', 'middle class', 'upper class').

data_properties.name: hasCulturalBackground
data_properties.description: Specifies a person's cultural, linguistic, national, or ethnic background relevant to social identity and biography.

usage_guideline.description: Capture salient dimensions of a person's cultural heritage or background, such as ethnicity, nationality, or linguistic heritage.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use culturally respectful terminology and, where necessary, link to controlled vocabularies.

data_properties.name: impactedLifeEvent
data_properties.description: Records the impact or influence that socio-economic or cultural background had on particular major life events or transitions.

usage_guideline.description: Use to annotate events with narrative or analytical comments about the role background factors played in event outcomes.
usage_guideline.constraints: Free-text or controlled vocab; should be used where explicit links between background and event exist.

data_properties.name: hasSourceProvenance
data_properties.description: Describes the custodial or transmission history (provenance) of a source, clarifying where it originated and how it has been preserved.

usage_guideline.description: Use for summarizing or referencing provenance documentation (e.g., archive reference, previous owners, acquisition trail).
usage_guideline.constraints: Value should be concise; may use archival/historical conventions for citing provenance.

data_properties.name: hasSourceReliability
data_properties.description: Represents an assessment of a source's reliability/credibility for documenting a life event or claim.

usage_guideline.description: Indicate reliability as free text or using a chosen controlled vocabulary (e.g., 'high', 'moderate', 'low').
usage_guideline.constraints: Use consistent evaluation criteria where possible.

data_properties.name: relationshipTypeInSocialRelationship
data_properties.description: Specifies the kind of social or professional relationship (e.g., mentor, colleague, friend) that links persons in a SocialRelationship.

usage_guideline.description: Describe the nature of the relationship using clear, controlled, or free text terms.
usage_guideline.constraints: One descriptor per SocialRelationship instance. Use controlled vocabularies if possible and contextually appropriate.

data_properties.name: hasRelationshipPeriod
data_properties.description: Associates a SocialRelationship with the time period during which it was active.

usage_guideline.description: Use ISO 8601 duration or simple date ranges to denote the period of validity of a relationship.
usage_guideline.constraints: Applicable to relationships that are time-bound; omit if duration is unknown.

data_properties.name: hasModificationDate
data_properties.description: Specifies the date and time when a document or source was last modified or updated.

usage_guideline.description: Record precise modification timestamps where available, using standardized date-time formatting.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should have at most one value per instance; use only if the modification date is known and tracked.

data_properties.name: hasAuthenticityAssessment
data_properties.description: Represents a textual or categorized evaluation of a source or document's authenticity.

usage_guideline.description: Record qualitative assessments, confidence levels, or notes about a source's or document's authenticity.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use controlled vocabulary or documented criteria where possible. Each instance should have one authenticity assessment if such information is available.

data_properties.name: hasSourceLanguage
data_properties.description: Specifies the language(s) in which a document, testimony, or source is recorded.

usage_guideline.description: Indicate the primary and any secondary languages of the resource, using language codes or names.
usage_guideline.constraints: Can record multiple languages if the resource is multilingual. Use ISO codes when possible.

data_properties.name: hasSourceFormat
data_properties.description: Describes the physical or digital format of a document, testimony, or source (e.g., manuscript, audio, video, PDF, paper).

usage_guideline.description: Specify the storage, encoding, or carrier medium relevant for accessing or preserving the resource.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use standardized vocabulary (e.g., MIME types, format names) where possible. Multiple formats may be specified if appropriate.

data_properties.name: hasConsentRestriction
data_properties.description: Describes specific restrictions, limitations, or conditions pertaining to the use of life history data under a given consent.

usage_guideline.description: Specify restrictions such as embargoes, allowed usage, anonymization requirements, or recipient categories.
usage_guideline.constraints: One restriction statement per consent; further details can be provided as needed.

data_properties.name: hasConsentAccessControl
data_properties.description: Specifies access control policies, required permissions, or other access-related constraints for records under a specific consent.

usage_guideline.description: Indicate who may access the data, under what circumstances, or with which credentials.
usage_guideline.constraints: Can codify policies as text or reference access control models.

data_properties.name: hasPolicyDescription
data_properties.description: Provides a textual description or summary of the content, terms, or scope of an access control policy.

usage_guideline.description: Use to provide human-readable documentation of access rights, constraints, or special conditions within a policy.
usage_guideline.constraints: One summary per policy instance; should reflect the substance of the access rules.

data_properties.name: providesInsight
data_properties.description: Indicates the interpretive or analytical insight that a given annotation, commentary, or tag supplies about a life event, narrative, or data entry.

usage_guideline.description: Use to summarize or record the main insight, interpretive theme, or added value delivered by the annotation.
usage_guideline.constraints: Use a concise summary (controlled vocabulary preferred if available); one per annotation.

data_properties.name: causedByFactor
data_properties.description: Specifies the major factor, circumstance, or event that contributed to a change in socio-economic status.

usage_guideline.description: Describe significant contributing factors (e.g., educational attainment, job loss, inheritance, health crisis).
usage_guideline.constraints: Use concise, controlled terms where possible; multiple factors can be represented by repeating property.

data_properties.name: associatedWithTimePeriod
data_properties.description: Indicates the time period during which a career milestone, legal event, or other life event occurred or was relevant.

usage_guideline.description: Use ISO 8601 date intervals or human-readable period summaries as appropriate; supports temporal queries over milestones and legal events.
usage_guideline.constraints: One association per event/milestone; must specify as precisely as possible.

data_properties.name: lastModifiedOn
data_properties.description: Indicates the date and time when a record element was last modified.

usage_guideline.description: Record the most recent modification timestamp for provenance and data management purposes.
usage_guideline.constraints: One modification date-time per element; should reflect the latest change.

data_properties.name: contributedByFactor
data_properties.description: Specifies a factor or cause contributing to the change of a household composition or living arrangement.

usage_guideline.description: Identify events, circumstances, or factors (e.g., marriage, birth, migration, financial change) that caused the household or living arrangement to change.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple factors can be listed as needed; use controlled terms where possible.

data_properties.name: highlightsTheme
data_properties.description: Specifies the particular theme, concept, or analytical lens that is emphasized or highlighted by an annotation, qualitative tag, or commentary.

usage_guideline.description: Use to capture the main topical, thematic, or conceptual focus made explicit by the annotation or tag (e.g., 'migration', 'resilience', 'access to education', 'identity').
usage_guideline.constraints: Prefer standardized vocabularies where available. Each instance should highlight only one theme; use multiple properties for multiple themes if needed.

data_properties.name: hasOfficialIdentifierValue
data_properties.description: Specifies the data value (e.g., number, code, alphanumeric string) of the official identifier assigned to a person.

usage_guideline.description: Record the exact identifier value as issued on the official document.
usage_guideline.constraints: One official value per identifier instance; sensitive and may require privacy/protection handling.

data_properties.name: hasIdentifierType
data_properties.description: Indicates the type or category of the official identifier (e.g., 'national ID', 'passport', 'driver’s license').

usage_guideline.description: Define the nature of the identifier using standard type designators.
usage_guideline.constraints: Controlled vocabulary should be used for identifier type terms.

data_properties.name: hasDemographicAttributeValue
data_properties.description: Denotes the value or classification (e.g., 'female', 'Hispanic', 'French') of a demographic attribute.

usage_guideline.description: Use clear, controlled vocabulary or standardized value terms reflecting the demographic property type.
usage_guideline.constraints: One value per attribute instance.

data_properties.name: hasDemographicAttributeType
data_properties.description: Specifies the type of demographic attribute, such as gender, ethnicity, nationality, etc.

usage_guideline.description: Categorize the demographic attribute using defined attribute types.
usage_guideline.constraints: Attribute type should be selected from a controlled list (e.g., 'gender', 'ethnicity').

data_properties.name: hasStatusDescription
data_properties.description: Provides a textual description or controlled value reflecting membership status (e.g., 'active', 'honorary', 'resigned').

usage_guideline.description: Assign a concise, standardized status description using predefined terms.
usage_guideline.constraints: Only one description per MembershipStatus instance; controlled list strongly preferred.

data_properties.name: accessedOnDate
data_properties.description: The date and time on which access to an individual's data occurred.

usage_guideline.description: Record precise timestamp of each data access for auditing purposes.
usage_guideline.constraints: One date-time per DataAccessRecord.

data_properties.name: accessPurpose
data_properties.description: The stated purpose or rationale for which an individual's data was accessed, as recorded in a DataAccessRecord.

usage_guideline.description: Use to record the official or declared reason behind data access (e.g., research, administration).
usage_guideline.constraints: Textual, concise reason; one per DataAccessRecord.

data_properties.name: hasNameValue
data_properties.description: Specifies the name value (e.g., full legal name, alias, pseudonym) that is part of a person's NameHistory record.

usage_guideline.description: Record the exact name used during the relevant period.
usage_guideline.constraints: One name value per NameHistory record.

data_properties.name: namePeriod
data_properties.description: Defines the date or time period during which a specific name was used by an individual.

usage_guideline.description: Document as a date range, start-end or narrative period.
usage_guideline.constraints: Apply ISO 8601 intervals or consistent textual period description.

data_properties.name: hasLegalStatusValue
data_properties.description: Records the specific legal status (e.g., citizen, married, single, resident alien) assigned to an individual for each LegalStatusHistory instance.

usage_guideline.description: Use well-defined, controlled terms for legal status.
usage_guideline.constraints: One value per LegalStatusHistory record.

data_properties.name: statusPeriod
data_properties.description: Records the date or period during which a legal status was valid for a person.

usage_guideline.description: Use a clear date range or ISO 8601 period representation.
usage_guideline.constraints: One period per LegalStatusHistory.

data_properties.name: hasIdentifierValue
data_properties.description: States the value of an official identifier within an IdentifierHistory instance.

usage_guideline.description: Record identifier such as number, code, or string.
usage_guideline.constraints: One value per IdentifierHistory record.

data_properties.name: identifierType
data_properties.description: Indicates the type of identifier (e.g., passport, national ID) in an IdentifierHistory record.

usage_guideline.description: Use standardized identifier type values.
usage_guideline.constraints: One type per IdentifierHistory record.

data_properties.name: identifierPeriod
data_properties.description: Specifies the time period during which a given identifier was valid.

usage_guideline.description: State the active period for the identifier as a date range.
usage_guideline.constraints: Single period per IdentifierHistory instance.

data_properties.name: hasSequenceOrder
data_properties.description: Specifies the position or ordering index of an EducationEpisode or Institution within an EducationalSequence, enabling chronological or custom ordering.

usage_guideline.description: Use this data property to assign a unique, consecutive order (e.g., 1, 2, 3, ...) to each episode or institution in an EducationalSequence.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each item in a sequence should have exactly one sequence order value; lower numbers represent earlier events. Sequence order must be unique within a given sequence.

data_properties.name: performedOnDate
data_properties.description: Specifies the date and time when a curation action took place.

usage_guideline.description: Record the timestamp of each specific curation, authorship, or modification action.
usage_guideline.constraints: Exactly one value per curation action.

data_properties.name: structuredAcrossGenerations
data_properties.description: Specifies the generational scope or patterning of a relationship (familial or non-familial), indicating how it is structured or propagated across multiple generations.

usage_guideline.description: Use to qualify or annotate a relationship with its generational context or patterning (e.g., intergenerational mentorship, multi-generational family ties).
usage_guideline.constraints: Describe as text or controlled vocabulary; only one value per relationship instance.

data_properties.name: hasParticipationPeriod
data_properties.description: Indicates the date or period during which a GroupParticipation episode was active for a person.

usage_guideline.description: Record as an ISO 8601 date interval or a precise narrative period; captures the start and end of a group participation.
usage_guideline.constraints: One period per participation instance; should be as precise as documentation allows.

data_properties.name: translationLanguage
data_properties.description: Indicates the language in which a particular NarrativeTranslation is available.

usage_guideline.description: Use ISO language codes or controlled vocabulary for language specification.
usage_guideline.constraints: One language per NarrativeTranslation instance.

data_properties.name: translationCulturalFramework
data_properties.description: Specifies the cultural framework or context applicable to a NarrativeTranslation, if adaptation goes beyond linguistic translation.

usage_guideline.description: Describe the cultural adaptation, if any, that is represented in a translation (e.g., through re-interpretation, contextualization).
usage_guideline.constraints: Only use when the translation represents a distinctive cultural adaptation.

data_properties.name: chronologicalResidenceOrder
